節目名稱: 舞蹈延續創作平台:《二延體》 2017
節目簡介: 作為本地舞蹈創作的搖籃，CCDC舞蹈中心推出舞蹈延續創作平台 ─《二延體》，為曾經發表過的舞蹈短篇作品加以灌溉，並提供一個延伸創作的機會，令其作品得以成長；同時讓本地的舞蹈創作菁英，再一次與自己的作品對話，深化及延展他們的創作。  今年九月，CCDC舞蹈中心再次引爆另類可能。《二延體》撮合了兩位編舞菁英李嘉雯和何樂宜，再次延展他們的創作。兩個延展的作品分別首演於東邊舞蹈團的《炫創者3》及香港演藝學院的「編舞工作坊二」。有別於其他年青編舞，李嘉雯和何樂宜更著重於形體及動作的表達和展現。她們嘗試擺脫舞蹈技巧的束縛和依賴，又以貼近社會和探究自身的角度積極反覆思索，創作出自由的舞蹈。因此，《〡夂〨〤》（李嘉雯編）以及《Mrs Murphy》（何樂宜編）所呈現的並非大眾一般認知的舞蹈美學，追求的並非如當代芭蕾舞的優美體態，而是在動作和肢體上迥然不同的風格、怪異的美與及年青編舞對舞蹈可能性的探索過程和結果。兩個作品奇異獨特，引人入勝，更加貼近「當代」的當代舞蹈，別具吸引力，相信能打破觀眾對現代舞的認識，並帶來視覺衝擊。是次《二延體》更有幸邀請本地資深舞蹈家黃振邦先生作為藝術顧問，指導及深化兩位年青編舞的作品，並於9月16-17日在CCDC舞蹈中心的賽馬會舞蹈小劇場再度呈現，帶領觀眾進入編舞的獨特舞蹈空間。
About the Programme: (Chinese Only)

節目簡介: 頂尖華人編舞黎海寧與重量級舞台演員李鎮洲一同解構前蘇聯時期著名作曲家蕭斯達高維契音符密碼。經典重溫，豈可錯過！   當代音樂的先行者蕭斯達高維契是樂壇的精神領袖，卻遭遇獨裁者史太林的狠批及排擠，一夜間由備受推崇的音樂界才子淪為政權打壓下的人民公敵，但他不甘屈服於強權，在消極的妥協表象下陽奉陰違，在往後的作品中佈下一個個謎語，隱藏對政治打壓的不滿、無奈及反抗。   從備受爭議的蕭斯達高維契回憶錄《證言》出發，黎海寧糅合舞蹈、音樂、劇場及電影元素，以多變出彩的舞台意象將蕭氏樂章的詩意及現實的殘酷巧妙融合。香港舞台劇獎最佳男主角李鎮洲再度擔綱演出，一時化身在生活壓力中痛苦掙扎的音樂大師，一時變身差利卓別靈式默片中的詼諧角色以及莎士比亞筆下的悲劇人物，穿插於電影、舞台、虛幻與現實之間。
About the Programme: WO CO was premiered Tokyo 2016.Kaori SEKI creates tranquil performances with dance choreography. In WO CO, she transcends visual perception and appeals directly to the skin. WO CO was created by taking inspiration from the various states and sensations of living beings: nature, humanity, primitivism, and modernity. Another inspiration was taken by the sensations of this modern world: its fear, its atmosphere, and its texture. WO CO is an archaic Japanese word which has several meanings: absurd, foolish, funny, or presumptuous. Also, the English word “WO” is the abbreviation of “warning order” as well as “wipe out” and “CO” is the one for “carbon monoxide.” The title itself implies those complex meanings.

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 - HOTPOT 東亞舞蹈平台：日本篇 I 《渾沌》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hotpot: Japan I "WO CO"
節目簡介: 《渾沌》於2016年日本東京首演。關香織以編舞創作安謐寧靜的舞台演出，《渾沌》一作超越視覺感知，營造切膚之感。《渾沌》從不同的狀態、以及生物的各種感官刺激當中取得靈感：自然、人文、原始主義、現代性等無不涵蓋其中。另一靈感來源是現代的世界：它的恐懼、環境和結構。渾沌亦為古日文，意義多重：荒誕、愚蠢、幽默或放肆，而英文WO則可以是Warning Order(警告)或Wipe Out(抹殺、清除)的簡寫，CO則是Carbon Monoxide(一氧化碳)的簡寫，作品名稱包含了有這些複雜意義的暗示。
About the Programme: "Jo (Kaohsiung)" Jo is Chien Lin-yi’s first creation to back to Taiwan. To rediscover his body how leavening by his native culture and what he saw in Japan. From Chinese title, it also is a metaphor for one person how to wake by an unstable position in a limitary square. This piece pays reverence for Jo Kanamori, his mentor and friend.  "Watcher (Kaohsiung)" Raining in the room was reviewed by Diane Baker from Taipei Times “Hung-Chung Lai comes into his own”. The inspiration for this piece is based on The Greek mythology “Argus “. The movements were derived from Eastern movement techniques to portray the trials and tribulations of Watcher.  Argus was described as a 100-eyed giant who had the ability to keep a few eyes open, even asleep, he was always alert. Argus had to slay Echidna, who is a servant to Hera, goddess of woman and marriage, the snake-legged monster and guard “Lo”, the cow that is tied to a sacred tree. However, as “Lo” was in league with Zeus, Zeus then ordered Hermes to disguise himself as a shepherd, to enchant Argus to sleep then taking all of his eyes to kill him.  Watcher is inspired by the story of Argus. Everyone has their weaknesses and sometimes it is not easy to see clearly their surroundings, As the Chinese proverb says, “on-lookers see more than the players”. People need a little guidance to help them see the truth, only then they will be able to trust more and protect the ones they love.  "Tschüss!! Bunny (Taipei)" While the Self deals with its decease by the past of time, should it accept the new I, or be constantly battling with it? Could conflicts between them be another kind of presentation of maintaining the connection? Or it simply creates the rivalry?  “Death” and “goodbye” to create the main concept of the dance, showing that perhaps death can be another form of rebirth.The main character of the dance is based on the similar sounds of the two terms, expressing the attitudes and philosophy of life when confronting parting and rebirth.Who are we saying goodbye to? What does the bunny represent in the dance? What are we being resentful for, being sorrowful for or even fighting for? Can we find any peace within? looking for a solution to everything the only approach for survival? Or perhaps when encountering the time pass, we would also be able to transit?  Who is the Self that we are departing from? What kind of I are we becoming? What things in life that we really need to say goodbye to? Or is saying goodbye to the old Self simply a manner of ours to make fun of the present?  "The Sacrifice of Roaring (Kaohsiung)" The Observer Selected by Judith Mackrell in “Three of the best dance performance this week” in Edinburgh Fringe 2016. Fires burn, ashes rise and flesh falls into the mud. Something wild is marching through the land, accompanied by the endless screaming of spirits. Inspired by Taiwanese rituals related to mortality and resurrection, the young firebrand choreographer Hsu Chen Wei and company reveal the human need to release all the pain in their lives to the gods. The result is the dance that is at once mysterious yet vivid, unexpectedly seductive and vital. A curtain silently closes as the wind howls across an abandoned shrine, and life carries on…

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 - HOTPOT 東亞舞蹈平台：台灣篇 《囚》《守》《再見吧！！兔子》《禮祭》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hotpot: Taiwan "Jo (Kaohsiung) " "Watcher (Kaohsiung)" "Tschs!! Bunny (Taipei)" "The Sacrifice of Roaring (Kaohsiung)"
節目簡介: 《囚》  編舞/演出：簡麟懿   《囚》是簡麟懿離開日本的舞團，第一支帶回台灣的作品， 一方面以作品中的動作元素向他的精神導師暨編舞金森穰致敬， 一方面是以《囚》這個會意字來隱喻簡氏從一國家進入另一國家，發現不同的文化/身體框架，進而回到一個「人」的覺知與修行，因此《囚》不一定是痛苦的。  除了被囚的枷鎖外，我們還可從自主的自囚裡，找到屬於自己的自由。囚，是自囚抑或被囚，在這框架裡的人不論是否自由，在這燈光下唯獨「它」能恣意地舞動。    《守》  編舞：賴翃中   靈感來自希臘神話百眼巨人「Argus」，意思為警戒的守護者。身上有百顆眼睛，在睡眠中，也能警戒著敵人。我們一輩子都在學習了解自己，然而這個世界存在著太多不可預測的因素，使人無法看清周遭事物。我們都需要他人的協助，逐漸看清楚這個世界與事物的真實。但看清之後，更堅信你所相信的。作品動作上帶有國劇武功的元素，表現為愛而奮鬥的守護者。    《再見吧！！兔子》  編舞：劉彥成   「揮別過去的自己，迎接那個我。」  —隨著時間過去，面對自己不斷死去，到底選擇接受那永不來臨的下一秒還是選擇持續下一秒對抗？死亡其實可以成為另一種形態的重生？作品表述關於面對道別與重生的生命態度。我們只能任憑時空的消逝帶我們過渡成為另一個層次的自己？而那個自己，又是誰？又將成為誰？    《禮祭》  編舞：許程崴   煙霧繚繞，瀰漫在神與人之間，模糊不清的場域正在悄悄轉換，火光燒逝，香灰隨風撒下，無盡的精神咆哮，肉體墜入泥濘，一場下對上的乞求，是尖叫嗎？一位穿梭在階梯間的使者，說道：「是神吶」，六隻腳踏呀踏著這片土，看得見一些失控，卻看不見為誰失控，是神嗎？那無形的東西與幾副交織錯綜的身體，落下又落下，拆散後又重新拼裝一番奇異人形，看似人不似人，瞳孔裡一抹黑，咆哮聲繼續，此時龕上剩下灰燼，風卻還在吹動著，無聲落幕，日子依舊。
About the Programme: "Four legs is good, two legs is better (Macao)" “In contrast, the pieces from Macau were much less classical and hinted at a fertile and wide-ranging culture of contemporary dance, from Albert Garcia’s cheeky Four Legs is Good, Two Legs is Better, that explores the idea of contemporary royalty and stars the best puffy white shirt I have seen since Seinfeld’s pirate version. Garcia primps and poses in his satin boxer shorts and the narcissism explored seems very culturally transportable.” RealTime issue #137 Feb-March 2017 pg.© Kathryn Kelly Royalty today comes in a different form. This rat race lifestyle can turn people upside down, forcing some to do unspeakable things only for a chance to get to the top. The pyramid stays the same. In this piece, with the modern day kings behind high-end suits present day slave in a crusty old uniform.  The pyramid has long existed.  "Flux (Macao)" One will go through different stages of life, and one will easily stay in his/her comfort zone. Comfort zone may not be an ideal mode of life, but we are all afraid of the impulse to change.  Life is always like this, after going around and around one will return to reality, and it all depends on the mood, attitude and reaction “you” choose to face reality. We all need to find the balance point to make our life becoming _____  "The Product Of (Hong Kong)" What if our souls are listed in a catalogue? Lists themselves contain hidden messages we seldom reflect upon. They can expand infinitely. In terms of time and space. This yet maybe classified as a metaphor as well — Umbrrto Eco (The Infinity of List)  "Limb Clock (Guangzhou)" “During the Jin Dynasty, on Shi Shi mountain In the town of Xin An, there was a man named Wang Zhi. One day, he came to this mountain in search for firewood. He saw several children playing chess – some of them were singing, so Wang Zhi walked closer to listen. One of the children gave him a mysterious item the shape of a date pit. When he swallowed it, he somehow didn’t feel hungry anymore. After a while, the child asked him, “Why haven’t you left yet?” When Wang Zhi stood up to leave, he saw that his axe was already entirely rotten. When he returned from the mountain, he could not find a single person who was from his dynasty.” Lan Ke Guan Qi (Watching Chess with a Rotting Axe)  Ancient Chinese people created mythology through an understanding of their own bodies. They were able to find sanctuary in a mysterious alternative reality, and subversively use this to reflect upon their own selves and the world around them. In the folklore of Lan Ke Guan Qi, the construction of time and space creates a profound sense of conflict and dissonance – time is kind and generous towards the deities and spirits of the mountains, yet it is cold and apathetic towards the living. Through this story, people are able to find comfort in the very real constraints that reality places upon their bodies, yet still continuously search for an imagination of timelessness and infinity.  Similarly, young people living in modern China constantly move through two-dimensional and three-dimensional spaces. In the age of selfies, internet romance, virtual reality and photoshop, people are searching for the utopian space outside the bounds of physical reality. Our bodies hence become huge vessels for time and space, containing the multitudes and complexities of god and human, self and other, male and female, strong and soft, passionate and indifferent…yet all this will one day fade and turn to dust.
Venue: Black Box Theatre, Kwai Tsing Theatre

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 - HOTPOT 東亞舞蹈平台：珠三角篇 《四條腿雖好，兩條腿更棒》《圓》《再造》《爛柯》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hotpot: Pearl River Delta "Four legs is good, two legs is better (Macao)" "Flux (Macao)" "The Product Of (Hong Kong)" "Limb Clock (Guangzhou)"
節目簡介: 《四條腿雖好，兩條腿更棒》  編舞/演出：艾伯特‧加西亞   時至今日，所謂的皇族以另一種形式存在。  競爭激烈，互相踐踏的生活模式令人顛倒，  迫得某些人不惜一切，為了攀上高頂而無所不為。  層階，金字塔，永恆不變 ...  現代版本的皇帝，身穿高級訂制套裝，  不也就是活在現世，穿著尤如硬殼盔甲制服的奴隸。  層階，金字塔，早已存在。   《圓》  編舞/演出：勞翠盈、劉美樺   一生中所經歷的不同階段，人是很容易便停留在所謂的舒適區。舒適區未必是自己理想上的生活模式，而是大家都害怕改變的衝動。  人生總是兜兜轉轉回到現實，而「你」以怎樣的心情、態度、方法去看待？  我們都需要找到生活的平衡點讓自己的生活變得_ _。    《再造》  編舞/演出：麥卓鴻   假若靈魂被列入「名單」當中？「名單」的形式本身，具備了我們平常不曾認真思考、卻很容易感受到的隱藏訊息。而「名單」有著可以隨時擴增的特性，沒有明確的邊界。然而，或許這是一個被收納的暗喻！ — 安伯托．艾可《無盡的名單》    《爛柯》  編舞：二高  演出：二高表演   古人喜歡用自己的身體來構想神話，在虛構的神秘中逃避現實，最終再用其反觀自身及周遭的環境。《爛柯觀棋》的傳說中，在時間與空間上構成一種鮮明的對立，時間對山中的神仙是寬容與美好的，而對凡人卻是冷漠與孤獨的。人們一面將自己的身體依托於現實的局限，另一面卻不斷追逐無限與永恆。  如同當下中國社會中的年輕人，不斷來回穿梭於二次元與三次元，在整容臉、人工智能、PS磨皮、虛擬CP中尋求現實之外的理想之境。而事實上，我們的身體就像一個巨大的容器，把時間和空間、神仙和凡人、自我和他者、男性和女性、強壯和纖柔、溫暖和冷漠都裝進了生命之體，但卻終將變為塵土。
About the Programme: "IN.VISIBLE (CITIES)" Choreography/Performance: Wayson POON  City, memory, desire, symbols, names, death, sky…..departing from Italo Calvino’s Invisible Cities, between the visible and invisible walls and gaps, the body saunters the virtual cities and writes Marco Polo’s travel journal with programming language. In this work, people reside in bow-like space (the city) and transit between boxes of various sizes. What connects these boxes? Questioning the text, the body, the new media, Siri, Google, and so on… The development of science and technology leads to the tendency of the different senses of the body, the human behavior is simulated, the simulation of all the actual situation. Senses are constantly being consumed, where can you find the authenticity of body?   "Here is it" Choreography: LI De  “Flying the flag of youthfulness, this work unveils the attitude of today’s youth in all its sincerity.”  A live rock show always stirs me. In that moment, it is as though the band members have infinite freedom, and they’re enjoying it. Breaking free of all life’s shackles, throwing away those shallow facades, hypocrisies and pretensions, the most genuine attitude of those of our age towards the world manifests itself in that very moment. Perhaps the elements that are about to happen on stage, at one point in the past or future, are truths tucked away in the depths of our heart. The piece has been chosen to present in the Seoul International Dance Festival (Sidance) 2015, the extension arts event of PAMS.   "Nook" Choreography: WONG Pik-kei  What is the possibility of a relationship? What is the pursuit of a relationship? Nook was commissioned and produced by the Hong Kong Arts Festival and was premiered at The Hong Kong Jockey Club Contemporary Dance Series 2017.

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 - HOTPOT 東亞舞蹈平台 : 聚焦香港 I 《看,不見(城市);》《這就是》《隅》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hong Kong Focus I "in,visible (cities);" "Here is it" "Nook"
節目簡介: 《看 ‧ 不見(城市)》 編舞/演出：盤彥燊  城市、記憶、慾望、符號、名字、死亡、天空…… 從卡爾維諾的《看不見的城市》出發，看見與看不見的城牆與隙縫之間，肉身遊走虛擬的城市，以電腦程式語言書寫馬可勃羅的遊記。作品中，人處於像盒子般的空間（城市），在大小不一的盒子中穿梭，而連接大小盒子的是什麼呢？向文本提問、向身體提問、向新媒體提問、向Siri提問、向Google提問…… 科技發展引導著身體的不同感觀的能力傾向，人類行為被模擬化，模擬一切的虛實。感觀不斷被消費，身體的確實性要從向處而尋？   《這就是》 編舞：李德  作品受搖滾樂啟發，呈現在我們這個年紀，面對當下，面對世界最赤誠的態度，是一場以舞蹈方式對搖滾精神的闡述。舞台上將要發生的，或許正是過去或將來被拿掉的真實。 舞蹈以七零年代風格呈現，並運用了不同類型的舞蹈，包括現代舞，中國民間舞，街舞，爵士舞等元素融合搖滾音樂及三個男生的日常對話的語言空間。  《隅》 編舞：黃碧琪  關係的可能性是什麼? 關係最終的追求是什麼?  《隅》改編自《太平山街71號》，該作品由香港藝術節委約及製作，於2017 香港藝術節之香港賽馬會當代舞蹈平台首演。
About the Programme: We are trapped in besieged fortresses. We are constantly faced with choices and struggles. Our reactions may vary, but this is exactly how the world maintains its bewitching patterns of balance.  Although it has been over 10 years since it was debuted, time may wither but the game remains as brilliant and extraordinary…  Cold Arrow premiered in Beijing in 2006.  This modern dance work filled with Chinese cultural imagery and was a dynamic debut of the newly formed BeijingDance/LDTX then.  Life is like a besieged fortress requiring us to take steps, often what we see in the small steps we take, we see black and white, good and bad, pros and cons.
Venue: Black Box Theatre, Kwai Tsing Theatre

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 : 聚焦香港 II 《回聲摺疊》《第十六天》《馨香》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hong Kong Focus II: "Folding Echoes" "Xin Xiang" "The 16th Day"
節目簡介: 《回聲摺疊》  編舞/演出：李偉能   我們如何面對世界，世界又如何定義著我對它的理解？  甚麼是常態？我在已知的世界還可以創造甚麼？   《回聲摺疊》是一個探討當代舞在現今社會，特別是在一個劇場空間內如何被解讀及觀看的舞蹈劇場作品。創作起源於觀眾渴望去理解或明白當代舞演出的想法，令我開始疑問當代舞是如何被接收、理解，觀眾又如何把台上的表演連繫自身的經驗，以及舞蹈是否能被語言盛載和轉化。整個獨舞都以建構某種可以被理解的邏輯為起點，包括各種劇場內的符號、指示、聲音、語言及燈光等，然後再去打破其秩序，在失落的邏輯中建構出另一種可被解讀的形態。當中以日常的動作素材、聲音、語言等的同步，再以重覆的步調去加強當中的關係，並逐步推演到後來的脫勾，在之前的認知中產生歧義。談論的內容包括動作的涵義、燈光與表演者的關係以及性別議題於劇場空間的呈現。而作品題目中的回聲既是指向演出當中語言與情境的重現，同時亦是帶領觀眾去思考劇場空間以及舞蹈的意義，讓他們產生疑問及好奇，並體驗一種與自身過往經驗的對話，是為回聲。    《第十六天》  編舞：陳曉玲   「第十六天」是充滿情感和自我鬥爭複雜性的作品。作品利用燈光和聲音的特別安排，開啟了作品和觀眾之間的對話，以吸引觀眾進入那失眠的世界。編舞放棄傳統舞蹈動作，嘗試創造另一種新的美學體，追求身體與精神狀態的一致性，一種不規律的郁動。從頭部開始抽動，然後通過大量重複，再擴大發展成一種形式的動作，以顯示舞者的精神狀態。音樂中混合了不同的聲音和旋律的組合而成，以反映大腦的掙扎。  「第十六天」從個人故事提問社會如何影響我們的個人價值，以及如何擺脫傳統的「美」。   《馨香》  編舞：周佩韻 (新約舞流)   舞蹈背後的意念源自中國傳統意象「樹」，一種象徵生存的符號、呈現生命的哲學理念。
About the Programme: Lab LIVE  Showcases of Creativity and Technology + Talks on Special Technologies  Impromtu Performance x Space x Lighting  “Movement Lab”   In a space of endless reflections, dancers, light and projections are chasing one another, chasing after physical bodies and projected lights and shadows. In this theatre space, the audience are above looking over the infinite extension of reality and optical illusions.

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 : 聚焦香港 III 《犢舞》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hong Kong Focus III : "So Low"
節目簡介: 《犢舞》  編舞/流出：黎德威   我，在其中被推移，被帶動，被擠壓一旁  我，在時空的滑道裡不斷尋找寄身之所  困在其中的存在，是否真的存在
About the Programme: Jo Kanamori, the Artistic Director of Noism1 and choreographer of NINA - materialize sacrifice, studies how one might produce an energy strong enough to give a sense of the beauty and power to a body before it moves in space, and explores how to create a body which would absorb the energy of the floor and would not fall even when being pushed. French born Vietnamese composer An Ton Th?t creates a compact music with mechanical sound and hammering percussion, together with the mysterious dim stage light, the piece transpires a sense of thrilling tension. The female dancers’ bodies are stiff like robots with no facial expression, yet their movement is sharp, fast and skillfully controlled, contrasting to the powerful but arbitrary manipulation of the male dancers. Acclaimed as a “compelling work”, NINA has toured to many cities including Paris, Moscow, Washington, Seoul and Taipei.
Venue: Black Box Theatre, Kwai Tsing Theatre

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 :《妮娜－祭品物質化》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival : "Nina - Materialize Sacrifice"
節目簡介: 這支作品是在表現我們如何在肢體行動中累積創造出足夠的爆發力，用來展現肢體的力與美。  Noism舞團藝術總監金森穰的《蓮娜──祭品物質化》，探究舞者在空間中舞動前如何能強而有力地散發肢體的美及力量，身體又如何接地氣以至被推而不倒？舞台在越南裔法國作曲家尊室安所創作緊湊的重節奏機械音樂以及若隱若現的燈光下，彷彿散發著驚慄電影般的張力，既彰顯女舞者們冷靜得如人偶卻又充滿力量、速感、極高控制度的動作，同時突出男舞者任意操縱的狂妄。作品首演時備受矚目，曾先後到巴黎、莫斯科、華盛頓、首爾及台北等地巡演。
About the Programme: A LOVE THAT MOVES HEAVEN AND EARTH  Lady White of West Lake is among China’s oldest pieces of Intangible Cultural Heritage, as well as a modern classic that has inspired countless film adaptations. This millenary love story begins on the sacred Mount Emei, where the spirit of a white snake transforms herself into a beautiful girl, Bai, to experience the human world. Emerging at the West Lake (Hangzhou), she meets a scholar, who opens her eyes to love for the first time. But their happiness does not last long: a vindictive monk becomes entangled in their quiet life. Outraged by the ominous union between man and spirit, the monk takes it upon himself to tear them apart. The resolute Bai defends her love with dignity and courage, even if it means fighting against heaven and earth.  Love is a lifetime of practice.
Venue: Auditorium, Kwai Tsing Theatre

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 - HOTPOT 東亞舞蹈平台：韓國篇 I 《無聲語》《飛》《生．克》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hotpot: Korea I "Silentium" "Flight" "Mind-Goblin"
節目簡介: 《生．克》  在一個價值觀糾纏、關係重疊的時代，我們過份投入生命的喜樂參半，變得異常緊張。負面的感覺、慾望、破壞及偏差在身心內沈澱，魔靈開始起舞。然而，只有在我們想隱藏或推開它們的時候，這些小妖才可以達成氣候，讓我們身心枯萎。  過渡是必要的，它承認負面是正面的前提，慾望是夢幻的另一表現，偏差是軌道的另一途徑，承認相剋者無需被移除，反而僅為相生的一個元素。  為此，我為自己身心的魔靈建了一個舞台，盡情表現它們，那些我曾經抑壓隱藏的魔靈，去面對及欣賞內裡的另一個我。而我們全部都渡過了令人振奮的美好時光。就像古老的故事那樣，人們遇見魔靈，徹夜起舞。我希望能理解到，我的身心本身就是一個微小的宇宙，也希望能真切感受到多元相生的美，以及創造那一個宇宙的美。    《飛》  你與我，為翼高飛，向目標進發。終於，飛翔接近完美。  為達成目標，我們經歷無數成敗。我們有時跌倒，有時筋疲力盡。但假以時日，我們終漸漸向目標飛近。《飛》利用飛躍動作，描述我們如何向目標起飛。人類不能獨自飛翔，局限卻由兩人突破，達致無懈可擊的一次飛航。    《無聲語》  最深邃的感覺總是在靜默中自我呈現。  或許是與自己鬥爭良久後的無聲沉默，也可能是對自己故意地視而不見。
About the Programme: "Tail Language" Tail Language is satirising the hypocritical culturalism and the analytical error of human language through movements that are motivated by the symbolic system of tail language and gesture from animals in imagination. It aims to break away from body and language through the process of dismantling and recombine from structural and semiotics movements such as the line and planes, or the intersection of lines and shapes. The emotion of outright egotism, the action of drawing a line between me and the others, changeable corrected conversations depending on the relationship or the analytical euro of language within moments. This work is a process that reveals the language of body, which is more primitive and lucid than text and words. It is a small but important attempt to discover ‘Truth’ on the opposite side of the social dialogue and relationships concealed by hypocrisy and superficial intellectualism.  "Body Concert" How much could we possibly deliver to the audience with our pure body? We attempt to communicate with the audience through our ‘Ambiguous Dance’ and if the communication goes well, the performance will be in a state of flux.  Body Concert aims to offer a thrill with our dance concert. Originally Body Concert was created in 2010. During the creation, Bo Ram Kim (Artistic Director) was focused on establishing the essence of Ambiguous Dance Company’s own movement. Body Concert was premiered at ‘Critic’s Choices’ and won the ‘Best Piece Award’ in 2010. Taking this opportunity, Ambiguous Dance Company was received attention in the contemporary dance scene in Seoul. And the piece was also performed during ‘MODAFE (2012)’, ‘ASAC Body Language Festival (2014, 2015)’ and ‘PAMS Choice (2016)’.

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 - HOTPOT 東亞舞蹈平台：韓國篇 II 《美尾道來》《身體演奏會》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hotpot: Korea II "Tail Language" "Body Concert"
節目簡介: 《身體演奏會》 單純的身體，能夠給予觀眾的有多少呢？我們以「曖昧不明」的舞蹈，試圖與觀眾溝通，假如溝通得宜，演出將會變動不息。《身體演奏會》以舞蹈為演奏，為觀眾帶來刺激。《身體演奏會》編創於2010年，由金保?編舞，奠定曖昧不明舞蹈團的獨特藝術語言。作品首演即獲2010年《舞評之選》及《最佳作品獎》，並吸引首爾當代舞壇的關注。此外，本作亦曾於MODAFE（2012年）、ASAC 身體語言藝術節（2014、 2015年）及PAMS Choice （2016年）等演出。    《美尾道來》 取材幻想中動物尾巴的「語言」及動作，創造一套象徵性系統，來諷刺虛偽的文化主義，以及人類語言的分析誤差。本作透過解構及重組結構性和符號性動作(如線條和平面、或是線條與形狀的交匯點)，嘗試脫離身體及語言。公然的自我主義情緒；在自我與他人之間畫線；根據關係而變換、經過糾正的語言；或是時刻之間語言的分析性歐元。這部作品是揭示身體語言的過程，而身體的語言比文本及字句更原始、更清晰，試圖發掘在虛偽與膚淺唯智主義遮掩之下，社交對話及關係的相反面，這樣的試圖雖然微小，卻甚重要。
About the Programme: What if we the young and the restless suddenly come to face to face with Mr. Confucius of the past? How shall we converse with him? admiringly? or disparagingly?  The Encounter of Confuciusis specially created for Shanxi Danceland by XU Yiming, the dancer/choreographer from BeijingDance/LDTX. The work has no intention to retell the story or re-interpret the teaching of Confucius on stage, but responds acutely and directly through pure physical movement to some of the words annunciated by Confucius himself (in the book of Confucius Analects)

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 :《當我們遇見孔子》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival : "The Encounter of Confucius"
節目簡介: 當今天的我們，遇見過去的孔子，是否無所適從，是崇拜他？還是蔑視他？  作品《當我們遇到孔子》由北京雷動天下現代舞團青年編舞家許一鳴專為舞洲舞團創團而作，以現代人天馬行空的思維碰撞傳統文化。十一位來自山西的年輕舞者無意描繪古代人物或演繹傳統哲理，卻用冷靜的目光和熾熱的胸懷，去舞動純粹的軀體，以回應和感受哲人曾經說過的（在《論語》中）一句又一句的話。

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017：《拜月犬 · 觀象》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival: "Moon-Looking Dog ?I Saw the Elephant"
節目簡介: 編舞家洪成佑是韓國舞壇第一人，開發動作的能力可謂無出其右，擅長表達人類內心，舞作流麗悅目，在國際舞台屢獲殊榮。  洪成佑帶領大邱當代舞蹈團，首次為香港觀眾帶來代表作品《拜月犬》及《觀象》。《拜月犬》曾獲邀參加2000年法國里昂舞蹈雙年展，尋覓包裹在社會身份下的真我；《觀象》直指事物本質，提示以心眼觀照萬物。只演一場，細數當代大韓文化之美！

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 - HOTPOT 東亞舞蹈平台：上海篇 《一撇一捺》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hotpot : Shanghai "FROM IN"
節目簡介: 《一撇一捺》 「我非常非常欣賞謝欣的作品和編舞。在她的風格中，我看見了未來，也許在歐洲現代舞沒有尋找到的未來。謝欣的作品有著和山海塾一般極致敏感微妙的獨特性和唯一性。」 芬蘭庫奧皮奧藝術節 藝術總監歐提奈  人與人之間會產生關於彼此的記憶，因為時間、空間上的相交點，產生連接，構成支點，否則我們只是沒有相交的一撇或一捺。
About the Programme: "born somewhere, live somewhere." Reina KIMURA left her hometown and came to Tokyo. She had not got used to live in a big city for a long time. In the unfamiliar life, she got interested in changes of the body by environment or language (dialect) and the state of people’s existence. This interest is one of the starting points of this work.  This work is constructed by dancers who come from the different hometown, Osaka, Hyogo, Oita, Aomori etc. And this work uses words (dialect) as one tool constituting a work. Reina and dancers try how changes a body, the consideration of the choreography, a work by migrating (changing environment) and residents. For previous five years, they continued and developed this work while changing a place, Kobe, Aomori, Kanagawa, Tokyo, Kinosaki (they lived 2 months).The work which continues to change as the life goes on. The work was premiered in 2013.  "one-piece" One of Co. Un Yamada’s earliest pieces originally premiered with five female dancers in 2004, it has been reproduced with all-male dancers after ten years of its production history in 2014. The futuristic sound is composed specially for this piece by Satoru Wono- an acclaimed cutting-edge music director and composer of Japanese music scene. This performance, “one ◆ piece” is crafted for the finest five of Co. Un Yamada dancers while choreographer Yamada brings the best out of each dancer and presents them on stage filled with bright white dance mat. That the audience will keep her eyes open not to miss a moment is undeniably happening.

節目名稱: 城市當代舞蹈節2017 - HOTPOT 東亞舞蹈平台：日本篇II 《生於彼．長於斯》《一．支》
Programme Name: 2017 City Contemporary Dance Festival - Hotpot: Japan "born somewhere, live somewhere.""one-piece"
節目簡介: 《一．支》 山田云舞團的最早期作品之一，2004年首演時由五位女舞者演出，十年後（2014年）由全男班舞者再現舞台。 作品充滿未來感的背景音樂由享譽日本音樂界的前衛音樂總監兼作曲家satoru wono創作，而是次演出的五位舞者，均為山田云舞團的頂尖成員，編舞家將每位舞者最優秀的地方呈現於放滿白色墊子的舞台之上。無容置疑，這樣的安排能讓觀眾目不轉睛地緊貼台上演出的每一刻。  《生於彼．長於斯》 編舞離開家鄉來到日本東京，但她很不習慣居住於大城市。她對於身體與周圍環境及語言產生的變化和人的存在狀態都很感興趣。這是作品的其中一個創作始源。  此作品由四位來自不同家鄉的舞者構成，分別是大阪市、兵庫?、大分市及青森市，當中運用了文字解讀作為一個作品元素。木村玲奈與其舞者在編舞上都考慮並嘗試發掘及試驗環境的轉變對身體的變化。在過去的三年內，他們一直轉換地點以發展此作品，例如：神戶、青森、神奈川縣、東京及城崎，他們曾經在城崎居住了兩個月。作品會隨著生命的前進而一直有所改變。 此作品的首演是於2013年。
Venue: Black Box Theatre, Kwai Tsing Theatre
主辦單位: 城市當代舞蹈團有限公司
演出/製作: 《生於彼．長於斯》 編舞及導演: 木村玲奈 舞者: 木村玲奈, 重里実穂, 田添幹雄, 遠藤僚之介, 佐藤有華 燈光設計: Asako MIURA 音樂: 堤田祐史 音響設計: 堤田祐史 攝影: bozzo, saori & joy   《一．支》 編舞及導演: 山田云 舞者: 小山晶嗣, 川合龙, 木原浩太, 酒井直之, 城俊彦 燈光設計: Asako MIURA 音響設計: 江澤千香子 攝影:

節目名稱: i-舞蹈節（香港）2017: 舊「舞」新「單」《不是雙人房》（選段）及《新舞蹈創作平台》
Programme Name: i-Dance Festival (HK) 2017: "Not a Double Room" (Excerpt) and "New Dance Platform"
節目簡介: 節目一及二 舊「舞」新「單」 經典再現  《不是雙人房》（選段）   《不是雙人房》於1995年首演、2010年重演，期間「多空間」更獲邀到台北、慕尼黑及廣州巡演。作品靈感源自編舞馬才和及嚴明然22年前歐遊的見聞，並受當年香港回歸前的社會狀況而啟發。今年是香港回歸20週年，這次重演又能帶來甚麼啟示？ 新「單」   一個晚上，兩個新舞蹈作品。三位來自不同文化背景的創作舞者，以今天的舞蹈語言，訴說當下。

節目名稱: i舞蹈節(香港)2017: 獨舞與即興《AIRE:獻給母親的小獨舞》及《緣舞場69》
Programme Name: i-Dance Festival (HK) 2017: Solo & Improv - "AIRE Solo for My Mother" and "Improvisation Land 69"
節目簡介: 今年i-舞蹈節（香港）邀得英國接觸即興大師Kirstie SIMSON主持一系列舞蹈工作坊，她將在展演中表演獨舞《AIRE：獻給母親的獨舞》，分享多年經驗及心得，更會與一眾舞者同台演出《緣舞場69》。
About the Programme: Praised as “the master of creating surrealist imagination,” Hsiao-Mei Ho is the highly attention-attracting Taiwanese female choreographer, and her works are imbued with rich imagery and humanistic reflection.   New Paradise of Silent Island is a collective creation with the spirit of Taiwanese cosplay. It drew together the Eight Generals, betel nut beauties, glove puppets, the Barbie doll, and other highly identifiable cultural symbols in contemporary Taiwan society. Blurring the boundary between reality and creation, the choreographer resonates with the audience deeply in a frame-breaking and interactive way, inviting them to wander around the stage under a diverse and chaos atmosphere of Taiwanese temple fairs.
Venue: Dance Studio, Kwai Tsing Theatre

節目名稱: i舞蹈節(香港)2017:《緣舞場70：舞在天空下》
Programme Name: i-Dance Festival (HK) 2017: "Improvisation Land 70: Dance Under The Sky"
節目簡介: 舞蹈、音樂及不同媒體藝術家共聚於新界鄉間田野，集體創作一觸即發！在天空下即興舞動，當下的視聽享受及動感能喚醒平日麻木的感官，觀眾與表演者於演出後一同享用餐宴，以色、香、味度過豐富一天！  當日活動包括導賞團、舞蹈及音樂表演、工作坊及餐宴。

節目簡介: 今天喧鬧的銅鑼灣，曾經是名符其實銅鑼型的寧靜海灣 今天車水馬龍環繞的蓮花宮，曾經孤伶的座落海旁  今天高尚住宅林立的大坑，百多年前是簡樸的小農村 今天已列入國家非物質文化遺產的大坑舞火龍，卻起源於137年前一個傳奇故事  我們的先民，平凡而偉大，他們的血液中流淌着中華民族不屈不撓的堅韌精神  他們勇於追求，幸福是自己爭取的  他們勇敢抗逆，在猛獸和災害面前挺身而出 他們面對病疫，千方百計找尋解救辦法  他們面對勝利，想的是香火精神代代相傳  火龍象徵火，在電光火石間，在熊熊火影中，我們的民族精神在昇華 火的洗禮，衝破一切，騰空而起
Venue: Auditorium, Kwai Tsing Theatre
主辦單位: 康樂及文化事務署 - 文化節目組

節目簡介: 《吉賽爾》是十九世紀浪漫主義時期的經典芭蕾舞劇。故事女主角吉賽爾為農村少女，與喬裝成農民的阿爾貝特伯爵戀上，可是阿爾貝特卻與巴蒂爾德訂婚。這個打擊使吉賽爾萬念俱灰，心碎而死。無比痛悔的阿爾貝特來到吉賽爾的墓前傾訴心曲，幽靈們欲置他於死地，幸得吉賽爾全力相護，他才得以倖免於難。
Venue: Grand Theatre, Hong Kong Cultural Centre
主辦單位: 康樂及文化事務署 - 文化節目組
Presenter: Leisure and Cultural Services Department - Cultural Presentations Section

節目名稱: 國際綜藝合家歡2017：舞蹈劇場《趣怪婆婆大戰搗蛋奇兵》
節目簡介: 毫不起眼的書報攤老闆，原來身懷絕技，每當有小朋友遇險時就會變身成趣怪婆婆，運用她的知識和超能力，助小朋友化險為夷。有一天，文仔過馬路時只顧看手機，差點遇上車禍，在千鈞一髮之間，趣怪婆婆出動拯救。原來文仔有很多壞習慣都是搗蛋大王和壞習慣三人組的傑作，為了幫助文仔擺脫這些惡習，趣怪婆婆找來同伴幫手‧‧‧‧‧‧
地點: 屯門大會堂大堂展覽場地，香港中央圖書館展覽館，葵青劇院大堂展覽場地，元朗劇院大堂展覽場地

節目名稱: 國際綜藝合家歡2017 : 《幻影穿梭》
About the Programme: Leaving his beloved rose, the Little Prince from asteroid B-612 starts his space odyssey. On his journey, he comes across the Earth, where he meets a pilot lost in the Sahara and makes friends with a fox and a snake... This story of love and courage eventually leads the lost pilot to the meaning of life hiding in the dark.  Based on The Little Prince, this dance theatre for families integrates contemporary dance, literature, music, live sand drawing and animation – an inspired, unexpected and unique interpretation of this well-loved classic.
Venue: Auditorium, Kwai Tsing Theatre
主辦單位: 康樂及文化事務署 - 藝術節辦事處
Presenter: Leisure and Cultural Services Department - Festival Office
venue_en: Kwai Tsing Theatre, Auditorium

節目簡介: 「阿隆佐·金舞蹈團的《心之躍動》以大師風範創造形體之美，並呈現心靈上的痛苦。」  美國《聖荷西信使新聞報》   「令人驚訝的遼闊音域、完美的詠唱，舞台功架十足。」 《百老匯世界》評麗莎．費雪   《心之躍動》由阿隆佐．金與格林美獎歌唱家麗莎．費雪攜手打造，以舞蹈向歌曲的力量致敬。在演出中，阿隆佐．金透過麗莎．費雪的歌聲力量探索人聲的動力學，發掘舞者的溝通潛能，使身體能成為樂器及演唱的和聲。 此作品描述舞者被麗莎．費雪的歌聲推動的旅程。費雪在語言未形成的起首處站崗，激勵舞者演進。舞者在她的凝視下散發光芒，把噪音化成和諧，心中燃起火焰。
Venue: Auditorium, Kwai Tsing Theatre
主辦單位: 康樂及文化事務署 - 文化節目組
Presenter: Leisure and Cultural Services Department - Cultural Presentations Section
演出/製作: 藝術總監: 阿隆佐．金編舞: 阿隆佐．金歌唱家: 麗莎．費雪燈光設計: 阿克塞爾．莫根特爾服裝設計: 羅拔．羅森華塞爾
Cast and Production: Artistic Director: Alonzo KingChoreographer: Alonzo KingVocalist: Lisa FischerLighting Designer: Axel MorgenthalerCostume Designer: Robert Rosenwasser
venue_en: Kwai Tsing Theatre, Auditorium

節目簡介: 結合默劇、舞蹈及馬戲的獨腳創意演出  在移動的窗櫥中尋找自我  一次完全揭開馬丁．齊默曼內蘊的荒誕幽默及揭示人性弱點與矛盾的嘗試  《喂！我好嗎？》由馬丁．齊默曼獨腳演出，作品注入默劇、舞蹈、馬戲和悲喜劇元素。這是一次完全揭開齊默曼內蘊的荒誕幽默及揭示他異想天開的創作過程的大膽嘗試。他為作品構建了一個框架作背景，並把它化身成一個看似是窗櫥的空間，當中呈現一位期望成為自己心目中形象的冷面幽默角色。看似靜態的穩固框架原來比觀眾所想像的更富動感和更脆弱，演出者嘗試去適應那越來越失控的表相世界。各種物件移動着在他頭上穿梭，幻象充斥空間，混淆虛幻與真實之間的界線。
About the Programme: The isolated guardian struggles between will and flesh Dances in the Labyrinth of Humanity  Solitary by Rex Cheng In the hub of life and death Feeling the desolation and emptiness of the weak Searching for the second pulse in life  Unmixed by KT Yau Describes the explicit attempt of humans to control others, which conveys the uselessness within an unescapable confinment. You are invited to catach a glimpse of the participants who are floating in the choices made of unconsciousness,and experience their trivialness.
Venue: Theatre, Hong Kong City Hall
主辦單位: 康樂及文化事務署 - 文化節目組
Presenter: Leisure and Cultural Services Department - Cultural Presentations Section
venue_en: Hong Kong City Hall, Theatre

節目名稱: 「舞蹈新鮮人」系列：程偉彬《獨．蝸》、邱加希《純生》
節目簡介: 與意志和肉身博弈的守望者 以舞蹈刻劃人性的迷宮  程偉彬《獨．蝸》  以生老病死為主軸 感受病患者的孤獨與虛無 為在世者尋找生命的另類溫度   邱加希《純生》  述說人的控制慾如何在關係中原型畢露， 呈現一種無法逃脫制約的無力。  誠邀你窺伺在無意識的選擇中跌宕的參與者， 並體會眾人的卑微。
About the Programme: In stillness there exists clarity, beauty and serenity   Forget the banality of everyday life and allow any feelings to arise within you, with mindful acceptance. Immerse your senses in the realm of nothingness, elevated by the sounds of the singing bowls and live improvised music. Vipassana is presented by HKDC Artistic Director Yang Yuntao, renowned scenographer Tsang Man-tung and award-winning composer Law Wing-fai. Join us in a soul-cleansing ritual.   Striking an intricate balance between movement and stillness – liberate your mind, welcome to your spiritual awakening.
Venue: Black Box Theatre, Kwai Tsing Theatre

Presenter: Leisure and Cultural Services Department - Cultural Presentations Section
製作/演出單位: 康樂及文化事務署 - 文化節目組

節目簡介: 佛蘭明高超級巨星伊娃．葉爾芭波娜帶同扣人心弦的新作《面貌》，載譽重臨。葉爾芭波娜聯同出色的舞者及她的優秀樂團，包括非洲歌唱家阿拉娜．辛奇的客席演出；她施展渾身解數，為觀眾送上精彩絕倫的表演。葉爾芭波娜以速度、力量和充滿戲劇感的舞步享譽舞壇，善於在表演中將傳統佛蘭明高的形體動作和自己的獨創風格糅合，是十多年來叱吒西班牙舞壇的大師級舞者。《面貌》是一個起源於印象主義、終結於深入反思的大熔爐。所有元素的表象下均蘊藏着另一重意義。受最正統、最純正的佛蘭明高訓練影響，伊娃．葉爾芭波娜展開了一段化繁為簡的旅程，途中一幕幕由舞蹈、音樂、人聲、燈光和字語交織而成的風景洋溢着滿滿熱情，幫助她擺脫所有自我束縛。眼光不再受眼睛束縛；藝術也不再受藝術家制肘。 像某種詩篇一樣，《面貌》的重點不在於瞭解，而是關於無形無相的感覺、面對和共存。葉爾芭波娜相信，沒有任何事物比佛蘭明高更當代。我們需要束縛，才可以在享受自由的同時保持自我。

節目簡介: 配合「一帶一路」的節目，由中國新疆生產建設兵團演出豐富多彩的中國民族舞蹈。  維吾爾族舞蹈《邊疆處處賽江南》、《饢兒香香》、《摘葡萄姑娘》、《夕陽樂舞人》、《盤子舞》及《刀郎舞》 哈薩克族舞蹈《伊犁河畔的倩影》、《幸福的日子》 塔吉克族舞蹈《高原鼓風》 烏孜別克族舞蹈《鈴鐺舞》 塔塔爾族舞蹈《繡》 舞蹈《絲路倩影》 歌曲演唱「心中的故鄉」、「最美新疆」及「我們新疆好地方」

About the Programme: Following the success of our 1st flamenco & clasico workshop with Paloma Gomez in 2016, we are happy to present again our 2017 workshop.  4 Courses will be offered:  Course A - Tientos (with CD music) 4 beats, suitable for those with one year's experience or more. (Elementary to Intermediate  Course B - Guajiras with bata de cola & fan (with CD music) 12 beats, suitable for those with experience of bata de cola. (Intermediate)  Course C - Tecnica Castanet Castanet technique suitable for beginners and all castanet lovers. Interesting castanet exercises help beginners to work out and offer enjoyment to the experienced. (Elementary)  Course D - Clasico Espanol (with CD music) Half the class on castanet flamenca, i.e. castanet dance combinations por fandangos, seguiriyas, etc. Half the class continue with the Clasico choreography "Sevilla". We start on a new part. Suitable for those with experience of dancing with castanet. (Intermediate)

About the Programme: If you can see the whole world in a flower, can you pass a whole life within one dream?  ‘Life has always seemed to me like a plant lives on its rhizome.  Its true life is invisible, hidden in the rhizome.  The part that appears above ground lasts only a single summer.  Then it withers away – an ephemeral apparition.  When we think of the unending growth and decay of life and civilizations, we cannot escape the impression of absolute nullity.  Yet, I have never lost a sense of something that lives and endures underneath the eternal flux.  What we see is the blossom, which passes.  The rhizome remains.’ – C.G. Jung, Memories Dreams, Reflections   Following her enquiry into the relationship between life and time in Dehydrated Flower, Tsui is using day-time flowering water lilies as the introduction, the human body as the media and voices as the navigator.  She repeatedly enters dreams that may be yours, mine or theirs.  As we experience the moments when each blooming water lily welcomes sunlight, are we in fact wandering between a ‘dream’ and ‘reality’?  Audience will be seated on the floor and is requested to take off their shoes before entering the performance area. Please dress casually and wear socks. Wearing pajamas are also welcome.  Audience will need to wear a headphone during the performance. Programme conducted in Cantonese.  Audience is strongly advised to arrive punctually.  No latecomers will be admitted.

節目簡介: 康樂及文化事務署於二OO九年起主辦「舞蹈新鮮人」系列，給予本地新晉編舞初嘗發表舞作的機會。二O一五年，康文署推出「續．舞」系列為「舞蹈新鮮人」提供了一個延續性的發表舞作平台。如果一花一世界，一夢是否一浮生？  「生命就像以根莖來延續生命的植物，真正的生命是看不見、深藏於根莖的。露出地面的部分生命只能延續一個夏季，然後，便凋謝了──真是一個短命鬼。當我們想到生命和文明永無休止的生長和衰敗時，人生果真如夢……我們看見花，它會消逝，但根莖，仍然在。」──榮格《回憶‧夢‧省思》  繼以《乾花》訪問生命與時間的關係後，這次以晝舒夜卷的睡蓮作引子、身體作為媒介、聲音來導航，反覆進入一個又一個可能是你、是我、或是他的「夢」。在經歷着每一朵在水中迎着陽光盛開的睡蓮之際，又彷彿遊走在「夢」與「現實」之間？  觀眾在進入演區前須脫下鞋履，並要席地而坐，請穿輕便衣服及襪子，亦歡迎觀眾穿着睡衣。      觀眾在演出期間需帶上耳機，節目以粵語演出。  觀眾務請準時入場，遲到者將不獲安排入場。

節目簡介: 陳敏兒《花生騷》  消耗是潮流，情慾如衣服。  秋季舞蹈劇塲最新上架，陳敏兒交叉黃琪交叉陳志樺，與一眾型男美女，惡搞時裝秀，解扣又解構，熱烈歡迎時裝火紅火綠史上大躍進。
About the Programme: One Table Two Chairs – Euro-Asia Young Performing Artists Cross-Cultural Exchange and Education Program, presented by Zurich University of the Arts (ZHdK), curated by Artistic Director Danny Yung, is a creative-education platform to advocate cross-cultural exchanges among young performing artists between Europe and Asia. Young contemporary and traditional performing artists and students from Taipei, Singapore, Nanjing, Hong Kong will gather in ZHdK for 3-4 weeks to carry out cross-cultural/cross-discipline creative workshops and collaborations with ZHdK students. In this program, participants will make use of “one table two chairs” as a platform for creative dialogues, discussions and developing collaborative performing artworks.

About the Programme: A double billed weekend performance in Dance and Theatre ​ A fantastic weekend of Swiss-ness with entertainment as well as encouragement to find our muse in life reflection, spurring one to shake off shackle and fight for one’s dreams.   Komplizen RELOADED by Cie zeitSprung Composed of dancers and musicians from Europe, Africa and Asia collaborating with one another, in an hour of engaging and fun provoking dance; it explores social affiliations and our need for security and support, the dancers embody our struggle to survive within a community. A performance tinged with love, humour and as life plays tricks on us, with a few surprising twists.   Concept/Dance: Kilian Haselbeck and Meret Schlegel Choreography and Dancer:  Meret Schlegel, Kilian Haselbeck, Kuan Ling Tsai, Manel Salas Live Music: Nello Novela   Fight! Palast by Peng Palast Inspired by the novel Fight Club byChuck Palahniuk; the ensemble takes us to a journey to construct a Fight! Palast (Palace) together, where its own fighting arena lives out suppressed desires, only to get knocked out by its own utopias. A theatrical inquisitive quest for a better self; muscle up and be the founding members of fight club!   Performers/Authors Nina Mariel Kohler, Christoph Keller, Dennis Schwabenland

節目名稱: 世界文化藝術節：躍動非洲《太陽之舞》
Programme Name: World Cultures Festival 2017: Vibrant Africa - "Tle (The Sun)"
節目簡介: 「Tlé」是西非迪尤拉語「太陽」的意思，代表生命之光，以及非洲人民的笑靨。在遼闊的非洲大地上，各個部族的豐富文化傳統，閃爍著色彩斑斕的耀眼光芒。在《太陽之舞》中，西非國家布基納法索的頂尖舞者與樂師，聯手帶來非洲傳統舞蹈和音樂寶藏，以超卓技藝為大家送上原始而熾熱，令人血脈沸騰的精彩演出。摔跤之技、神聖的面具舞、吟遊詩人攝人的歌唱一一呈現，觀眾恍如置身王族的庭園中，沉浸於節日盛宴熱鬧的氣氛、歡悅的旋律和強勁的節奏，忘情地手舞足蹈。《太陽之舞》的編舞奧利華．達柏加家學淵源，他集音樂和舞蹈傳承於一身，作品風格更涵蓋傳統及當代領域。在過去二十二年間，他獲邀到全球超過五十個國家教學及演出，並贏得多個獎項，包括美國何頓舞蹈獎及美國國家舞蹈計劃之巡演資助等。誠邀閣下一同踏上這趟旅程，一睹西非文化的動人風采！

About the Programme: In the Event by Crystal Pite World premiere 16 April 2015, Lucent Danstheater The Hague Duration 20 minutes “Tellingly, is the final image of the solitary man who tries to chart and analyze his environment with small, compulsive acts.” TROUW, Netherlands “The expressiveness is so pure that In The Event becomes an intense and magical experience.” LEIDSCH DAGBLAD, Netherlands  Shutters Shut by Sol León and Paul Lightfoot Première 6 March 2003, Lucent Danstheater Den Haag Duration 4 minutes “A playful but sophisticated dance of gestures, making sense in the same way its text score, Gertrude Stein’s “If I Told Him: A Completed Portrait of Picasso,” does: not at all, and completely.” The New York Times, United States “Easily the best piece is Shutters Shut, a four-minute setting of a Gertrude Stein poem by Lightfoot and Leon. As the poet's words pile into a precarious rhythmic edifice, so the dancers' gestures are repeated and varied with impossible articulation and speed. Simultaneously daft and brilliant, you feel Stein would have loved the two performers and so did we.” The Guardian, United Kingdom  Woke up Blind by Marco Goecke World premiere February 4 2016, Zuiderstrandtheater The Hague Duration 15 minutes “With an almost unearthly intensity (Goecke) lets music and dance merge together. And again it is his movement idiom that is intangible and therefore appeals to the imagination.” Leidsch Dagblad, Netherlands “Surrealistic dance poetry.” de Volkskrant  Safe as Houses by Sol León and Paul Lightfoot World premiere 14 November 2001, Lucent Danstheater, The Hague Duration 30 minutes “In this magical 'appearing and disappearing’- ballet by Paul Lightfoot and Sol León the dance speaks for itself: every body turn is compelling and exciting, the tension evoked compelling, inescapable.” De Volkskrant, Netherlands "(León and Lightfoot’s) work is built around theatrical resources and performed with Olympic dance power. The reprise 'Safe as Houses’ (2001) is known as the vanishing ballet with dancers around a circular wall, and counts as a reflection on the maneuverability of the soul." Trouw, Netherlands

節目簡介: 克利絲桃．派特《揮別》 世界首演 二Ｏ一五年四月十六日，海牙路聖特舞蹈劇院 節目長約 二十分鐘 「最後的意象最為突出：孤獨的人以微小、不由自主的動作，嘗試打量與分析自己的環境。」荷蘭《忠誠報》 「《揮別》的純淨表現力成為濃得化不開的奇妙體驗。」荷蘭《萊頓日報》  蘇爾．利昂及保羅．賴福特《若然告之》 世界首演 二ＯＯ三年三月六日，海牙路聖特舞蹈劇院 節目長約 四分鐘 「玩味十足但舉手投足都相當複雜的舞蹈，和用以配樂的文本（格特魯德．斯泰因《如果我告訴他：一幅已完成的畢加索肖像》）反映的意義如出一轍：完全沒有，或完全有。」 美國《紐約時報》 「顯然，最佳的作品是《若然告之》，賴福特及利昂在這段四分鐘的舞蹈上，採用了格特魯德．斯泰因的詩作為背景音樂。以詩人的用字堆積成可疑的節奏結構，舞者的造手隨著不可能的發音和速度重複變化。既愚蠢又英明，斯泰因應該會喜歡兩位表演者，我們也一樣。」 英國《衛報》  馬可．歌克《若瞎若醒》 世界首演 二Ｏ一六年二月四日，荷蘭海牙南海灘劇院 節目長約 十五分鐘 「（歌克）以近乎超然的激烈程度，讓音樂及舞蹈二合為一。當然，最能引發聯想的是他那無形的肢體雋語。」荷蘭《萊頓日報》 「超現實的舞蹈詩篇。」《荷蘭人民報》  蘇爾．利昂及保羅．賴福特《穩若泰山》 世界首演 二ＯＯ一年十一月十四日，海牙路聖特舞蹈劇院 節目長約 三十分鐘 「這部奇幻的『現身與消失』芭蕾舞表演由保羅．賴福特及蘇爾．利昂創作，精彩之處不言而喻：每一次轉身都充滿力量而令人激動，舞者間的張力喚起無可抵擋的說服力。」《荷蘭人民報》 「(利昂及賴福特的)作品以劇場資源構建，以奧運的舞蹈力量呈現。舞者在再次搬上舞台的《穩若泰山》（二ＯＯ一）中圍繞著一道圓牆，上演一段消失的芭蕾舞，反映靈魂的操作性。」荷蘭《忠誠報》
Venue: Auditorium, Kwai Tsing Theatre
主辦單位: 康樂及文化事務署 - 文化節目組
Presenter: Leisure and Cultural Services Department - Cultural Presentations Section
演出/製作: 《揮別》編舞: 克利絲桃．派特音樂: 奧雲．貝爾頓鋼琴錄音: 贊尼．蘇滕燈光: 湯姆．韋沙舞台設計: 喬．高爾．泰勒服裝設計: 克利絲桃．派特, 祖克．維瑟 《若然告之》編舞: 蘇爾．利昂, 保羅．賴福特燈光設計: 湯姆．彼伏特 《若瞎若醒》編舞: 馬可．歌克戲劇指導: 娜嘉．卡代爾音樂: 傑夫．巴克利(你和我, 年輕愛侶的方式)燈光設計: 烏多．哈伯爾蘭舞台設計

About the Programme: National and international, resident and visiting artists have brought their unique creative talents to the creation of the extraordinary range of works that will be presented in the School of Dance Fall Performances.   The performances will feature four works, three of which will be premiers created together with the students of the School. We are delighted to have welcomed Raymond Chai (Malaysia) and Leila McMillan (the United States) who have, throughout the fall semester, created two new works together with the Ballet and Contemporary students respectively. Chinese Dance students have been working with the Head of Chinese Dance, Professor Sheng Peiqi and Chinese Dance Lecturer, Yan Xiaoqiang in the creation of work based on the Chinese legend, The Butterfly Lovers. Completing the programme is the reconstruction of, Lure, a work performed by the Ballet Department. The piece was originally choreographed for the School of Dance by Anh Ngoc Nguyen (Vietnam) which has not yet been performed in Hong Kong, was presented to great acclaim in both mainland China and Europe.   The Architecture of 無 is created by London based dance artist Raymond Chai, for Ballet Department students, has taken inspiration for this new work from Prokofiev’s fast and dynamic classical symphony. The work explores the classical technique, revealing a contemporary treatment of a recognisable movement vocabulary. The other work that will be performed by the Ballet Department is Lure by Anh Ngoc Nguyen, a fast paced, technically demanding work that has been received, to high acclaim, by audiences both in Asia and Europe.   Leila McMillan’s new work Three fingers at arms Length, created for students from the Contemporary Department, looks at the work of visual artist Fipsi Seilern diving into a world of double identities; stepping into your shadow and being swallowed by clouds.   The Chinese legend of The Butterfly Lovers, has seen many varied interpretations. Often used as inspiration for productions, it has, over the years, manifested in a variety of theatrical and cinematic forms. In the Fall Performances, the poignant story of the lovers is re-visited by the students of the Chinese Dance Department.   We are very much looking forward to welcoming you at the performances.
Venue: Basketball Court, Tin Wah Estate

Presenter: Leisure and Cultural Services Department - Entertainment Office
venue_en: Basketball Court, Tin Wah Estate

節目名稱: 世界文化藝術節：躍動非洲《當初》
Programme Name: World Cultures Festival 2017: Vibrant Africa  "Somewhere at the Beginning"
節目簡介: 首度訪港 震撼演出  謝曼恩．阿科尼是當代非洲舞蹈的奠基者。她在一九六零年代前往法國習舞，之後將西方古典舞和現代舞的特質，融匯到非洲傳統舞蹈之中，創造出自成一格的現代非洲舞蹈技巧。多年來，她獲得的獎項和榮譽數不勝數，包括倫敦舞蹈和表演獎、紐約「貝絲獎」、法國文化部「藝術及文學司令勳章」，並入選發行全非洲的《青年非洲》雜誌「全球最具影響力的五十位非洲人」。現年七十三歲的阿科尼老而彌堅，仍繼續堅持她的夢想，活躍於演出、編舞和教學工作，藝術節嚴選兩個由她親自演繹的代表作《當初》和《本相》，風格迥異，卻同樣能量驚人。  結合非洲傳說和希臘神話元素，阿科尼在這個充滿自傳色彩的多媒體作品中，透過聲音、影像、氣味、物件、情感和肢體等元素，與身為約魯巴女祭司的祖母、極力想擺脫非洲身份的父親，以及自身的傷痛經歷對話。
About the Programme: A new generation of Hong Kong dance artists are now shaping Hong Kong’s contemporary dance scene. The nine captivating works showcased at the JOCKEY CLUB New Arts Power have been performed overseas, brought to the international arena by HKADC. These artists demonstrate the vibrancy of Hong Kong’s modern dance and are promising to lead the dance scene in future.   Ivanhoe Lam ODDS Individuals cross each other’s paths, a connection takes place. The question is, however, whether or not we realise its existence. Chun-ho Ivanhoe Lam, a multi-disciplinary choreographer, collaborates with Wan-wa Shirley Tsoi and Wei-wei Lim, two multi-talented performers, and other team members – Swiss composer Benjamin Ryser, sound artist Fabian Gutscher, multi-media designer Oliver Shing, and stage designer Jason Wong – to forge an orbit within the soul that allows for introspection.  Justyne Li and Wong Tan-ki Galatea X In Greek mythology, sculptor Pygmalion falls in love with his own creation Galatea, a statue. Breathing life into his statue, the sculptor is at once being shaped by his own creation. Such intriguing transformation is irreversible, so is the metamorphosis of this dance work.  Chen Kai Line II  Line II explores the “geometric human body” in relation to its “linear movement”. Gun shu, a martial performing skill in traditional Peking Opera, has been incorporated to the piece to illustrate the nature of linear distances between men and objects.
Venue: Theatre, Hong Kong City Hall

節目名稱: 世界文化藝術節：躍動非洲《本相》
節目簡介: 首度訪港 震撼演出  謝曼恩．阿科尼是當代非洲舞蹈的奠基者。她在一九六零年代前往法國習舞，之後將西方古典舞和現代舞的特質，融匯到非洲傳統舞蹈之中，創造出自成一格的現代非洲舞蹈技巧。多年來，她獲得的獎項和榮譽數不勝數，包括倫敦舞蹈和表演獎、紐約「貝絲獎」、法國文化部「藝術及文學司令勳章」，並入選發行全非洲的《青年非洲》雜誌「全球最具影響力的五十位非洲人」。現年七十三歲的阿科尼老而彌堅，仍繼續堅持她的夢想，活躍於演出、編舞和教學工作，藝術節嚴選兩個由她親自演繹的代表作《當初》和《本相》，風格迥異，卻同樣能量驚人。   這是以顛覆傳統美學聞名的法國著名編舞家奧利華．杜博思專程為阿科尼而編的舞作，希望透過阿科尼身體中蘊藏的非洲靈魂，來與史達拉汶斯基《春之祭》中「被選中的舞者」對話。喜尋求突破的杜博思與充滿爆炸力的阿科尼，合作併發出這個衝擊視覺感觀和舞蹈概念的破格之作。

About the Programme: Reviewers call her "dynamite", "brilliant", "a marvel". Michelle Dorrance is one of today’s most sought after tap dancers and choreographers. She’s guest-starred at the Winter Olympics and Cannes Film Festival, and her staggering list of awards includes the MacArthur 'Genius Grant', a Bessie and – following in the footsteps of legends like Merce Cunningham – the prestigious Jacob's Pillow Dance Award. Dorrance set up her own dance company in 2011, winning a Bessie Award with its first show, for "blasting open our notions about tap" according to the jury citation. She re-invigorates a uniquely American dance form by blending the musicality of tap with the choreographic intricacies of contemporary dance. The company has triumphed at the Kennedy Center, Chicago Contemporary Art Museum, and in Paris and Barcelona. ETM: Double Down, an enhanced version of the Jacob's Pillow Dance award-winninging piece, is a perfect fusion of movement and sound. With a specially designed sonic set that responds to the performers' steps, dancers and musicians led by long-time Dorrance collaborator Nicholas Van Young engage in glorious rhythmic dialogue.  Pure bliss!

About the Programme: Thrilled to be entering our 6th year, The Series is growing with our choreographic stars and trying out new formats. This edition features familiar elements while striding into uncharted territories. With an international collaboration, cross-discipline commissions and a mixed bill showcasing emerging talents, it brings together trained dancers with non-dancers to explore the art of creativity and movement. Will you still love me tomorrow? Hong Kong Remix A high energy dance off  The first international collaboration for the HKJC Contemporary Dance Series, this special commission is built on the Artist-in-Residence project of Italian choreographer Alessandro Sciarroni with Hong Kong choreographer Mao Wei, who took part in the HKAF in 2016. Continuing their partnership and building on Sciarroni’s acclaimed FOLK-S, they further explore the counterpoint in Eastern and Western dance and folk traditions. This full-length new work features professional dancers from Hong Kong and will also include selected local students. It is developed over a series of workshops and rehearsals in Hong Kong.

About the Programme: On a space of incompleteness She senses her way Following the fragrance of powdery black Softly licking a barely visible wound This black solo dance performance enters a world of leftover particles, the powdery soot making random patterns. Black drinks all other colour. Civilisation and cultural human behaviour leaves traces. The powdery soot makes its own dance threatening the existence of living beings. Still sublime beauty comes alive in this process. This solo has toured the world and is dedicated to SU-EN愀 father, which has this darkness inside of him.

About the Programme: Inspired by the endangered and distinctive bird crested ibises and the spices’ aesthetic, elegant and enchanting characteristics, the dance drama Crested Ibises showcases a traditional Chinese tale that appeals to the audience to invoke the deep thought in us to live in harmony with nature, and to live with natural environment and living creatures as companions.   Why the dance drama Crested Ibises has been performed across Japan near 100 times and widely renowned since its debut in 2014? In 2018, the performance is excelling and will tour around the United State and Russia...... just because the precious species is known as the “bird of auspiciousness” to the Imperial House of Japan and as the “bird of good fortune” to the people of Japan.   With an aim to promote art diplomacy and in line with China’s Belt and Road initiative kicking off in Hong Kong, the fund raised from this performance will be donated to Hong Kong Baptist University Century Club “Student Ambassador Scheme” to sponsoring students in conducting exchange in foreign countries, practicum and experiencing the Belt and Road – A Tour of Artistic Diplomacy and Hong Kong Baptist University School of Chinese Medicine. In addition, the fund raised from this performance will be donated to the Commission on Poverty of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China and Enlai Charitable Foundation.

節目簡介: 世界上有一種東西可以任意飛翔！它叫夢想 香港本地原創踢躂舞音樂劇 小飛，一個小孤兒，自幼就跟着老鞋匠海叔生活。這位收留了小飛的海叔，在他的家中永遠高高掛着一對鉛造的踢躂鞋。小飛只要一有時間，就會穿起踢躂鞋，到處起舞有一天政府頒佈了一條新條文，下令全城只有合資格的舞者才可以跳踢躂舞，其他人一律禁止起舞。海叔為了令小飛可以繼續跳舞，決定去找一位老朋友幫忙；同一時間，小飛邂逅了Alex……到底海叔家中那雙鉛造踢躂鞋有什麼用？他要找的老朋友是誰？小飛又會與Alex擦出什麼火花？他們最終能不能繼續跳踢躂舞呢？

節目簡介: 一個觀衆參與的多媒體舞蹈劇場，觀眾可以透過旁觀或窺探方式參與演出，作品結合舞蹈、劇場及錄像投影等，與觀眾一同探索香港人在回歸二十年後的生活與內心世界。觀眾的參與將成為《房一房二房叉防》的一部分。  《房一房二房叉防》中生活的超級人類，也許是你的朋友，也許是你的家人，也許是你…！  「多空間」誠邀你來見證及參與，並成為《房一房二房叉防》中超級人類的一份子…！

節目簡介: 城市當代舞蹈團是香港首屈一指的現代舞團，由現任藝術總監曹誠淵於1979年創立，舞團曾多次獲邀代表香港到海外演出，以別具創意及深具香港特色的製作贏得國際美譽。  參加本活動的中小學生可現場欣賞到舞團多位香港本土新進編舞最新創作的舞蹈選段，亦會欣賞到舞團近年大力推動的《跳格國際舞蹈影像節》委約及得獎作品。優美的舞蹈示範輔以導賞員的講解，有助同學了解現代舞蹈如何融合不同媒體，創出令人意想不到的作品。此外，同學亦可透過有趣生動的舞蹈解讀遊戲，發掘舞蹈背後的創作意念，從而激發無窮的創意思維。
About the Programme: Named and famed for jazzing it up  Explosive and original, Canada’s most exhilarating dance company is famed for “jazzing up” the ballet classics. Sensational collaborations between world-class dancers and talented choreographers are now a hallmark of this internationally recognised company.  Israeli choreographer Itzik Galili’s Mono Lisa updates the classical pas de deux. In a tale of seduction set to a funky mechanical score, a man and woman play cat and mouse. It’s sensual and acrobatic, with breathtaking movements en pointe. In contrast, driven by Pérez Prado’s joyful Cuban music, Galili’s O Balcao de Amor ﬁzzes with comedic sparks and delightful absurdity.   Kosmos by former Béjart and Lyon Ballet dancer Andonis Foniadakis takes inspiration from the rhythms, the craziness and energy of big cities to celebrate humanity and its creativity. Set to Phillip Glass’s minimalist solo piano piece, Closer, by much sought after choreographer Benjamin Millepied, is the voluptuous, vibrant exploration of tension between two human bodies.   Les Ballets Jazz burst into life in Montreal in 1972. Its work has since graced stages in more than sixty-six countries. This programme showcases all the artistry and energy that have made it famous across the globe.

節目名稱: 「HKSTYLE中國舞」教育導賞演出《也文也舞花木蘭》
Programme Name: HKSTYLE Chinese Dance ducational Performance - "All about Mulan"
節目簡介: 集忠、孝、勇、智於一身的花木蘭，其代父從軍的傳奇事跡，傳頌千古，充分體驗出中華民族的孝和義。香港舞蹈團將帶領觀衆穿越北朝樂府詩--《木蘭辭》的文學世界，與這位舉世歌頌的巾幗英雌以舞相會。從文字的詩意脫變優美的舞步，用身體的動律呈現經典的文學；透過舞蹈的表演形式，舞者與觀眾一同由嶄新的角度切入，學習和感受花木蘭「唧唧復唧唧」的溫婉柔情，以及「將軍百戰死」的堅毅勇猛。《也文也舞花木蘭》將糅合舞蹈、戲劇、音樂的藝術元素，發揮香港舞蹈團的舞動力量！  中學專場 3/3/2017  社區專場 4/3/2017  親子專場 5/3/2017 《HKSTYLE中國舞》教育導賞演出分為兩個部分。上半部分先以中國舞基本功示範揭開序幕，接著為同學帶來多姿多彩的中國民族舞蹈演出。下半部分則以香港舞蹈團大型舞劇為主題，藉精彩選段演出，讓同學了解舞劇的特色。另特設互動環節，讓同學一嘗親踏台板的滋味。

節目名稱: 2016/17大專生藝術通識計劃 (舞蹈) -「藝虛」總結演出暨展覽《真假距離》
Programme Name: 2016/17 General Education in Arts Programme for Tertiary Students (Dance) - 'In Search of Motion in a Virtual City' Finale Performance cum Exhibition : "Grey Area"
節目簡介: 漫遊虛實世界　探索內外之間  本年度新約舞流為「大專生藝術通識計劃」籌備為期約八個月的活動－「藝虛」。「藝虛」為全新的舞蹈教育計劃，透過舞蹈、陶藝及視覺藝術，探討時下人們在虛擬與現實世界中的生活及生存空間。同時希望參加者能於專業藝術家的指導下在藝術知識上有所增長，並能與來自不同院校的參加者，作進一步的認識及交流。承傳新約舞流的藝術宗旨，本計劃期盼讓年輕人透過藝術積極探索自身與社會的連結。  《真假距離 Grey Area》 光暈下搖曳的身影 遠近交疊  來不及聚焦的視線 瞥見印象 迷離惝恍

About the Programme: Dance Day 2017 will be the 8th Dance Day.  The main theme of this year is 'No Boundary'.  Dancers would unveil their adventurous spirit, desire for breakthrough and pull down the wall between audiences and dancers.   Similar to previous Dance Days, Dance Day 2017 will showcase different generations of local dance talents.  Veteran and emerging dance artists, professional and amateur dance groups as well as local organizations serving the physically handicapped and able-bodied will join hands with different social groups to give a wide variety of delightful and exhilarating dance performances and activities at Tuen Mun Town Hall and Tuen Mun Cultural Square.   Renowned local choreographer/ dancer, Andy Wong is invited to be the Event Advisor for Dance Day.  Moreover, participatory activities such as workshops and exhibitions will be organized.  There will also be the 'U Can Dance!' Free Dancing Zone where everyone is welcome to join in and enjoy the fun of dancing.  Content: Dance Showcase ‘U Can Dance!’ Free Dancing Zone One-minute Flash Dance Site-specific Flash Mob Dance Improvisation Land Public Square Dancing Cultural Activities Hall Presentation Workshop  Souvenirs are available for participants on a first-come-first-served basis.

節目簡介: 英國攝影師邁布里奇的動態攝影與傳奇人生 舞蹈形體劇場的視覺動感體驗  深刻的愛情 背叛的痛苦 致命的報復  「《移形換映》遠遠不只是一個普通的人生故事，它展現了非凡的懾人劇力，當中充滿隱喻、幻想和多層次的意像。」 捷克電視台  《移形換映》融合了當代舞蹈、形體劇場和破格的視覺藝術，演繹英國著名攝影師邁布里奇的攝影作品、感情生活和傳奇人生。當邁布里奇埋首研究攝影時，他的妻子卻與一名劇評人發展婚外情。邁布里奇槍殺了太太的情人，最終因為「合法殺人」而被判無罪。其後，他以多部攝影機拍下馬匹奔跑的動態，不但成為其代表作，更標誌着「定時攝影」的誕生。他亦發明了早期被稱「動物實驗鏡」的動態攝影裝置，即影片播放器的原型，預示電影時代的來臨。魔幻燈影劇場與邁布里奇的作品之間有很多共通點，動作、攝影和電影將兩者串連起來。

節目簡介: 舞蹈日2017將會是第八屆的舞蹈日。 今屆主題為「無疆界」，展示舞者的冒險精神，不斷尋求突破，從而打破觀眾與舞者之間的界限。  舞蹈日2017將展示本地舞蹈界的全方位力量。資深及新進舞蹈家，將聯同專業及業餘舞團，以及傷健人士服務團體和不同社群一起於屯門大會堂及屯門文娛廣場演繹不同風格、多姿多采的舞蹈及活動。我們特別邀請到本地資深舞蹈家王廷琳擔任活動顧問。 同時，大會亦安排了工作坊及展覽等推廣活動，以及舞蹈自主地帶「舞得起！」，讓市民一起舞動，享受舞蹈的樂趣。  精彩內容： 舞蹈匯演 舞蹈自主地帶「舞得起!」 自由舞動一分鐘 環境舞蹈快閃 緣舞場 廣場舞蹈 文娛廳演出 工作坊  參加者可獲贈精美紀念品乙份，數量有限，送完即止。
地點: 屯門大會堂及屯門文娛廣場

節目簡介: 《魔幻舞影》是一場結合大型幻術和多種舞蹈的精彩表演，包括百老匯式歌舞、踢躂舞、社交舞、爵士舞、凱爾特舞蹈、魔術和歌唱元素。全新製作由榮獲艾美獎提名的導演米高．郎迪拉以及安東尼．斯特列特攜手創作。斯特列特是米高．佛萊利《舞王》的前首席舞者並於二Ｏ一一年推出個人作品《凱爾特幻術》。《魔幻舞影》則是《凱爾特幻術》的衍生劇目。新作除加入了更多舞蹈元素，亦着力以令人屏氣凝神的的奇妙魔法俘虜觀眾的心。
About the Programme: Wi Wa Wit (Wit means “white” in German) is a sense-stimulating dance performance about winter and all its facets. The performers use dancing, acting, live music and design to take the audience on a discovery journey. The children are seduced to watch, listen and feel. Every performance ends with a conversation and the children are taught a dance sequence.

節目簡介: 看看、跳跳、聽聽歡樂的冬天! 雪花在半空中飛舞，雪大得伸手不見五指。在大雪籠罩下，世界顯得格外不同。一切變都是潔白的，世界一片寂靜……是誰， 是什麼， 隱藏在這張白色毛氈下？ 《白色世界》是一部刺激感官、為觀眾揭示冬季不同面貌的舞蹈表演。表演者透過舞蹈、戲劇、現場音樂和設計元素，帶領小觀眾一起進行探索之旅。幕幕精彩演出，吸引兒童細看、聆聽及用心感受。。每一場表演都以對話作結並讓小觀眾齊齊學跳一段舞蹈。

節目簡介: 大型原創舞劇《沙灣往事》以上世紀三十年代廣東沙灣古鎮為背景，以「何氏三傑」等廣東音樂人為創作原型，圍繞經典名曲《賽龍奪錦》薪火相傳的內容主線，用舞蹈元素演繹傳奇故事的發展，以及優美生動的舞段詮釋一個有關廣東音樂的愛情故事。深刻的主題、新穎的敘事方式、流暢的舞蹈演繹、精巧的舞美設計、動人的經典配樂，以及如詩如畫的舞台呈現，為觀眾展現了一部波瀾壯闊、激昂奮進的廣東音樂史詩。
About the Programme: A boy. A girl. Two rival gangs. One fatal love affair.   Described as 'The No.1 Greatest Musical of all Time' by The Times, UK, WEST SIDE STORY is as relevant today as it has ever been.   Inspired by Shakespeare’s tumultuous love story Romeo and Juliet, and set amidst the vicious rivalry of teenage gangs in 1950s New York, WEST SIDE STORY’s ground-breaking choreography and unforgettable score changed the face of musical theatre for ever when it burst onto the Broadway stage in 1957.  Now a vibrant new stage production of the classic dance musical is coming to Hong Kong, following wild acclaim and sold-out seasons around the world, from London, Tokyo and Sydney.  An outstanding international cast will electrify audiences with their passionate high-energy dance routines and their astounding vocal range in such classic songs as Maria, Tonight, Somewhere, America and I Feel Pretty.  WEST SIDE STORY packs a powerful punch, both dramatically and musically. The movie version went on to win an incredible 10 Oscars (including Best Picture) and further cemented the reputation of this undoubted masterpiece.
Venue: Grand Theatre, Hong Kong Cultural Centre

節目名稱: 天然肉體詩人舞踏演出
節目簡介: 天然肉體詩人的創作融合了日本傳統舞蹈及日本舞踏的特性，再配合瑜珈、氣功、禪修的呼吸式去塑造更深層的人類的靈魂及身體獨立形成的想像。

About the Programme: Hong Kong Ballet Group Stars Award is the first ballet competition in Hong Kong. Entrants will compete in Solo and/or Group Dance Competition.  Since its inception in 2000, it has drawn nearly 7,000 entrants and has become one of the major ballet events in the territory. For impartiality, independent artists who are not affiliated with local dance schools are invited to be the adjudicators for the Competition.

About the Programme: The workshop is a intensive West African dance experience focused on the rhythm of the dansa celebration. Emphasis is placed on groundedness, polyrhythm, and position of the head, torso, legs and arms, as well as isolated articulation of the body. Along with live music, the class is high impact and cardiovascular, with lots of moving, chanting and breathing.

節目名稱: 第53屆學校舞蹈節優勝者表演暨頒獎典禮
Programme Name: 53rd Schools Dance Festival Winners' Performance cum Prize Presentation
節目簡介: 在第53屆學校舞蹈節獲得優等獎的中、小及特殊學校的隊伍將於節目中演出各類精彩的舞蹈包括中國舞、西方舞、東方舞、現代舞、兒童舞、爵士舞及街舞。
About the Programme: As part of its spring programme – and doubling up as the opening event of the first Academy Festival – the School of Dance will be presenting four works, three of which are new creations developed with the students of the Contemporary, Ballet and Chinese Dance Departments. The fourth work is a re-presentation of the much loved Faint Parallel Lines, choreographed by John Utans, Senior Lecturer in Contemporary Dance. The work, which explores ideas of simultaneous existence and thought, looks at the way different structures and patterns exist independently, in real life and in art, and the moments when these patterns and paths cross, collide or continue to run side by side.   International artists, drawn from across the globe, have brought their unique creative talents to the creation of the three new pieces and during their time at the Academy have immersed students in practices that will be needed in the professional world that some students will soon be joining.   The Australian choreographer Gabrielle Nankivell has created a work called Cat Dérive with students from the Contemporary Dance Department, in which the routines and rhythms of the city's inhabitants build a moving map that traces our shared environment. Each individual's idea of order is different - what might be chaos for one may be order for another.   The London-based choreographer Cameron McMillan has been working this semester with the Ballet Department to develop a work The Inheritance of Form that expands on ballet’s pure and physically formal architectural base to evolve and re-define the form and explore possibilities for ballet in the 21st century.   Gao Chengming has created a work called Fortunes with students from the Chinese Dance Department, investigating the idea that no matter what the results may be, one’s wishes are all the same at the beginning.
Venue: Auditorium, Sha Tin Town Hall

Programme Name: Tung Wah Group of Hospitals i-dArts: "Painting in Dance III Look! I Dance...."
節目簡介: 編織藝術演化成另一種形態的畫作，「畫中舞III ─ 看我 .... 舞」是一個將布藝及舞蹈結合的多媒體藝術表演。當中的作品都是由布藝創作者與不同能力的舞者約八十名藝術愛好者合力創作。希望帶給觀眾一個既充滿視覺享受、情感豐富及富實驗性的表演。

節目簡介: 站在邊緣，我看見的是螻蟻般的行人是如此的微不足道。也許當太陽再冉冉升起時，世界已經將我遺忘。我一躍而下，誰料到這只是一張通往後死亡國度的通行證。如果死亡是我人生僅有的選擇權，死，於我而言又有何懼，怕的是對過去的執著和死後的未知。當生活成了生存，死亡比活著來得更輕鬆，我還有留下的理由嗎？掙開眼睛，是一個眼熟的地方，但迎來的卻是令人茫然的空間。回不去，也走不了，我只好一步步再探索一切，讓新國度帶給我新角度。

節目名稱: 《嶄新歷蹈》－牛池灣文娛中心場地伙伴計劃
Programme Name: "Estival Feats" - Ngau Chi Wan Civic Centre Venue Partnership Scheme
節目簡介: 當代舞林 10   嶄新歷蹈  力破主旋律的舞蹈行者  偏向新國度探索，靈感歷盡泉湧衝撃，傾力打磨成瑰偉舞作。
About the Programme: How does the world look to the very young? Is it round or square? Orange or blue? Perhaps even soft, yellow, oval AND hollow! In this internationally applauded production, three Lithuanian dancers return to the world of the under-threes. Based on the concept that colours and shapes help build cognition, the performers use brightly hued geometric shapes to form puzzles and simple objects such as fruit and vegetables. At the same time, they demonstrate to the early-life audience how familiar movements and skills at different stages of development – crawling and rolling, tumbling and toddling, galloping and running – can be turned into an artistic experience. With musical accompaniment masterfully composed to make youngsters feel at home, children can later join in the playful scenes on stage.
Venue: Theatre, Ngau Chi Wan Civic Centre

節目名稱: 《燃脈》－牛池灣文娛中心場地伙伴計劃
Programme Name: "Seething On" - Ngau Chi Wan Civic Centre Venue Partnership Scheme
節目簡介: 永燃不滅的原創藝力  五位才華橫溢的編舞漫遊於同一空間，記憶與想像交錯，於舊日軌蹈上開創新面貌。演出分別由創作獲舞界好評的莫嫣；愛跳愛演、活躍於不同媒介的馬師雅；善於掌握節奏和張力的邱加希；熱血突破身體界限的丘展誠；以輕鬆幽默意念連繫生活與世界的陳俊瑋編演。
About the Programme: “Hong Kong Ballet has a fine tradition of presenting a choreographers' showcase nearly every year. This enables some of its own dancers to try their hands in creating new pieces.” -- Kevin Ng, EJ Insight on Choreographers' Showcase 2016 Praised for “a number of promising first works from new [choreographers]” by South China Morning Post, the annual Choreographers’ Showcase presents original, bold new ballet works by emerging dance artists from within and beyond Hong Kong Ballet. Meet the choreographers who are set to elevate Hong Kong’s arts scene in the 21st century with their fresh, progressive pieces at Choreographers’ Showcase 2017. Held in an intimate space, this innovative showcase will leave audiences wanting more. This vibrant collaboration among the Company’s dancers celebrates raw athleticism and dynamic movement to create a truly unique evening of dance.  Join us as we come together to witness this striking 21st-century programme of diverse works and artists!  With-IN by Luis Cabrera Luis Cabrera examines the raw emotions of fear, loss and longing in his new creation.  Infinity Awaits by He Chaoya & Li Jiabo Set in old Shanghai, a woman waits for her long-lost lover. Why does she do this if she knows he will probably never show up?  Following the success of last year’s Night Thoughts, He Chaoya and Li Jiabo come together again to create this new piece with Chinese dance elements especially for the Hong Kong Ballet dancers.  Demons by Hu Song Wei Ricky Extracted from and inspired by everyday life, award-winning dancer/choreographer Hu Song Wei Ricky depicts living with humans and demons in his new piece.  Same Old Joe by Lucas Jerkander "Leukemia is a group of cancers that usually begin in the bone marrow and results in high numbers of abnormal white blood cells."  Without finding a donor for a bone marrow transplant, it's a life and death struggle with the disease. Lucas Jerkander creates Same Old Joe which is inspired by real events and uses the voice of ballet dancer Joesph Bunn.  L'espoir by Leung Chunlong “The night is long but it will meet the day.”  Hope is beautiful yet distant. It also drives us to do our utmost even through great hardship. Leung Chunlong’s new work illustrates what hope personally means to him.  The Bow by Li Lin A bow is powerful yet flexible. It can be a line, or it can be bent, made into circle and much more. In The Bow, Li Lin shares his unique perspective with a bow.  BubbleGoose by Jonathan Spigner Jonathan Spigner gets back to the roots of raw creativity and focuses on the dancing material.  A Rebel At Heart by Yang Ruiqi “I myself decide who I will be. This is me!”  In A Rebel At Heart, Yang Ruiqi shows how a rebel transforms rebellion into art.

Programme Name: "Exploring Creative Moments" Choreography Course Finale Performances
節目簡介: 為你開啟創作之門，讓肢體連結內心世界，發掘對生活的想像。導師傳授編舞心得和技巧，分析舞蹈結構；拆解空間、意念、動作的關係和運用，從而啟發學員的創造力，引導學員編創具個人色彩的舞作，於總結演出中與觀眾分享成果。

About the Programme: Hong Kong Dance Federation proudly presents the award-winning production Dunhuang Reflections in response to One Belt One Road at the Kwai Tsing Theater. Its excerpt “Austere Image” has won the New Prague International Dance Festival 2015 Special Award and the Best Director Award for the full production in The 5th Minorities Art Festival of China. This enhanced version will include new dances of Heavenly Guardians, the Water Margin Guan Yin and Silk Road Harmony to further illuminate the glamour of Dunhuang's beauty.
Venue: Auditorium, Yuen Long Theatre
venue_en: Yuen Long Theatre, Auditorium

About the Programme: Bursting with balletic fireworks and bravura steps, this exuberant production of "Don Quixote" abounds with love, illusion, daring, and adventure in the colourful streets of Spain. The idealistic, eccentric Don Quixote goes on a quest full of adventures with his loyal squire Sancho Panza in search of his perfect woman, Dulcinea—while real-life lovers Kitri and Basilio battle against all odds to unite in true love.   Based on Petipa/Gorsky’s choreography with Nina Ananiashvili’s staging and additional choreography, this ballet features guest ballerina Iana Salenko (Staatsballet Berlin and The Royal Ballet) and is a tour de force, requiring the dancers to tackle some of the most technically demanding choreography in classical ballet with gravity-defying jetes, fearless lifts, and impressive pirouettes. Based on Cervantes' iconic Spanish novel, "Don Quixote" is a must-see ballet for all the family—a glorious dance spectacle packed with virtuoso dancing, gorgeous costumes, a fanciful storyline and a lively cast of characters.
Venue: Studio Theatre, Hong Kong Cultural Centre

節目簡介: 這裡… 是我們相識的淵源， 是連繫著我們緣分的地方， 使我們從毫不相識， 到彼此之間無所不談。 如果我們不曾因「源」相遇， 是否會有這份「緣」的出現? 我們現在又會置身何地? 緣生於源，亦聚於源， 而「源」於這裡…

節目名稱: 法國五月銀禧紀念 《花都芭蕾舞傳奇 : 今夜星光燦爛》
Programme Name: Le French May Silver Jubilee "Paris Ballet Legends: A Night with the Stars"
節目簡介: 《花都芭蕾舞傳奇：今夜星光燦爛》由藝術總監方坦執導。它對巴黎和受巴黎啟發的藝術家致敬：從蕭邦至普魯斯特、佩蒂特至卡爾內、佩蒂巴至琵雅芙、比才至普萊維爾……每一場表演，都與這個光明的城市有密切的關係。   最美妙的雙人舞以不同風格的舞藝演繹不同的故事：浪漫的《吉賽兒》、現代風格的《不，我絕不後悔》、經典超卓的《黑天鵝》、膽色過人的《永遠的卡門！》和新芭蕾風格的《茶花女》…… 表演的高潮，是三對舞蹈員在《在夜裏》（改編自蕭邦的《夜曲》）翩翩起舞，由載譽國際的法國鋼琴家巴爾達擔任伴奏，而編舞的是屢次獲獎的編舞家、真正熱愛巴黎的羅賓斯。

節目名稱: 法國五月銀禧紀念《中間》
Programme Name: Le French May Silver Jubilee "In The Middle"
節目簡介: 嘻哈領域競爭激烈，只有最優秀的能留下來。同時，嘻哈也是一個幾乎全由男性主宰的行業。首席舞者兼舞蹈編導莫婷希望以這部作品證明，女性也能在嘻哈世界佔有一席之地。  莫婷把這場演出打造成電影一樣。她喜歡使用圖片和展示，而非口頭講解，由觀眾自己去詮釋其中的含義。光是表演的關鍵部份，貫穿整場演出。她用聚光燈模仿相機的閃光燈來產生人物投影，並加強作品的感染力。  瑪莉安‧莫婷是一位跨界舞蹈編導。年僅五歲時，莫婷就開始跳古典舞。1996年，她意識到自己對嘻哈滿腔熱情，便開始在街頭跳舞。她曾和國際著名流行歌手麥當娜合作，並藉此積累了經驗。比利時歌手司徒邁發現她深具潛力，給她介紹了更多跳嘻哈舞的機會。2015年，她參加了歌手克莉絲汀和皇后們的《人性熱》專輯巡演。
About the Programme: Break out of routine. Seize life with both hands.  The high-octane, feel-good Danz Up 2.0 is a spectacular new dance drama with over 20 dancers and actors, who take to the streets with their dreams as urban dance warriors in the city. With choreography by Shing Mak (choreographer of the hit homegrown dance movie The Way We Dance) and music by Day Tai (two-time winner of Best Original Film Song in the 33rd and 35th Hong Kong Film Awards), this young energetic cast led by veteran stage director Tang Wai-kit and award winning playwright Matthew Cheng will perform a spectacular dance off.  Highly acclaimed with 10 performances sold out in 2016. Don’t just stand there. Get movin’.

節目名稱: 法國五月銀禧紀念《西門說》
Programme Name: Le French May Silver Jubilee: "Simon Says"
節目簡介: 艾曼紐 .汀 法國 ╳ 香港合作項目  法國五月藝術節與不加鎖舞踊館合作呈獻艾曼紐‧汀的新作《西門說》。2015年艾曼紐‧汀赴香港交流時受到四位香港舞蹈員的啟發，與他們一起編寫了這部原創舞蹈劇。  讓我們把兩個兒童經典遊戲結合起來：《西門說》與《西門》遊戲，後者就是那個根據聲音和色調界定，運用四個顏色按鈕重複特定序列的電子桌上遊戲……承擔風險、自我控制、精神集中、腎上腺素上升……它們看似簡單，卻載著順從與疏離並存的空間。  兩個遊戲裏的四個玩家—四位香港舞者—與艾曼紐‧汀於在香港舉辦的工作坊相識，繼而隨之造訪法國勒拉佛爾研習。即興創作、接受或打破已啟用的規則、反思創作材料的本質、放下一切顧慮—這些對於四位慣於偏重實踐、學習與快速理解的表演者來說，意味著一個獨特的，探索舞蹈的方法。《西門說》是從這兩個藝術方針延伸出來的；它糅合了高度效率、高超技巧、對遊戲的喜愛以及自身的重新表述。讓遊戲在服從與反抗之間開始吧！  在香港的演出前，《西門說》於2017年1月25及26日在法國勒拉佛爾Pharenheit舞蹈節中首演。
About the Programme: In response to 2017 Southern District Tourism and Culture Festival

節目簡介: 今個九月尾，在藝穗會地下劇場誠意獻上「舞蹈、戲劇JAM音樂」的晚上。在本地樂隊SAGAS的現場音樂伴奏下，將上演「停不了－ 在舞台上的心跳」勵志舞蹈劇以及幾個足球員「守」著的友誼故事。  「停不了－ 在舞台上的心跳」講述自小熱愛跳舞的魚在追夢的路上困難重重，對夢想的堅持產生了動搖，最後明白到勿忘初衷，享受舞台、享受音樂、享受身體替你抒發的一切。只要用心跳舞，哪裏都會是舞台。  「守」是一個以足球講述香港人生活的故事。主角由童年時開始接觸足球，機緣巧合下成為了守門員，成年後依然以足球維繫他與踢波友的友誼。這並不是一個熱血奮鬥的故事，因為足球事業在香港並不蓬勃。每個人在球場上都有屬於他的位置，如果生命就是一場足球比賽，你守的龍門又是什麼？
Venue: Fringe Underground
演出/製作: 《停不了－在台上的心跳 》演出：伍頒恩，黎嘉恩     《守》演出：姚安珊、陳湛文、文傑聰、洪瑞珙
Cast and Production: "Unstoppable" Performer: Wing Ng, Nicole Lai    "Sagas" Performer: Anson Yiu, Peter Chan, Jack Chung, Hiro Hung
venue_en: Fringe Underground

節目名稱: 香港回歸二十週年慶典系列活動之非遺系列文化巡演2017: 舞劇《香巴拉》
Programme Name: Modern Dance Drama of Tibet "Sham BhaLa"
節目簡介: ｢非遺系列文化巡演2017｣，以香港這個大都會舞台為平台，邀請來自雲南省滇劇院、兄弟藝盟-周龍工作室、北京的香巴拉劇團和香港藝術團隊等，共同呈獻一連6天的“非遺表演藝術盛宴”。  《香巴拉》 由著名藏族舞蹈家萬瑪尖措老師編導，中央民族大學舞者傾力演出，經歷國內外上百場巡演洗禮再臨香港。作品探討童年回憶、族群身份認同及藏傳佛教生死輪回等主題，帶領觀眾走進“香巴拉”秘境。表演融合西藏古典舞、土風舞、金剛舞與現代舞等形式及現場繪製壇城沙畫等藏文化行為藝術，致力於呈現人體線條、律動與多彩的視覺衝擊，展現真切藏族風貌。

節目名稱: 一桌二椅 ─ 榮念曾的舞蹈計劃交流演出
Programme Name: One Table two Chairs - Dance Project with Danny Yung
節目簡介: 由香港先鋒藝術家榮念曾策劃，瑞士蘇黎世藝術大學主辦的「一桌二椅──歐亞青年表演藝術家跨文化文流及教學計劃」，是「蘇黎世與香港的約會Zürich meets Hong Kong – A Festival Of Two Cities」節目之一。該計劃目標是建立一個促進歐洲和亞洲年輕表演藝術家之間跨文化交流的創意教學平台。來自曼谷、香港、南京、台北、日惹、蘇黎世的藝術家及表演者，聚集在瑞士蘇黎世藝術大學（Zurich University of the Arts），利用「一桌二椅」作為平台，展開創意對話、討論及共同創作，並以演出總結交流成果。
Venue: Hong Kong Academy for Performing Arts

About the Programme: Steaming hot buns, freshly brewed tea. We’ve got a table at Lung Fung for you!  The Hong Kong Dance Company Children’s and Youth Troupes along with professional dancers will take over the delicious world of Cantonese dim sum, bringing their dance talent to a heartwarming tale full of laugh-out-loud moments.  Featuring dancing teacups, saucers and dim sums, this story explores the city’s yum cha culture, which has tied generations of Hongkongers together. Grandma, an excellent dim sum chef who built her own teahouse, Lung Fung, which is always full to the brim. But still, popularity can’t fight rocketing rent.  On its final day, Grandma’s greatest wish is to sip tea and enjoy dim sum at Lung Fung with her granddaughter. Alas, the little girl is caught between tutorials and exams, leaving Grandma disappointed.  Two pieces of dim sum feel sorry for Grandma, and take her granddaughter back to the high time of teahouse culture. Filled with reminiscence and great excitement, the young girl even gets to meet her Grandma in her youth!
Venue: Cultural Activities Hall, Sha Tin Town Hall

About the Programme: ‘LINES Ballet’s The Propelled Heart masterfully conjures physical beauty and spiritual anguish.’- San Jose Mercury News, United States ‘Astonishing range, perfect intonation, mastery of the stage.’ - Broadway World on Lisa Fischer  Alonzo King and Grammy Award winning vocalist Lisa Fischer’s stunning collaboration The Propelled Heart pays tribute to the power of song through dance.  Alonzo King explores the kinetics of the human voice in choreography that combines the power of Lisa Fischer's voice with the communicative potential of the body as an instrument through the expressive LINES dancers.  The piece is a voyage, with the dancers impelled by the voice of Lisa Fischer.  She acts as a standing sentinel at the inchoate pre-verbal beginning. Under her gaze the dancers radiate their light and churn noise into harmony, hearts ablaze.
Venue: Y Theatre, Youth Square

venue_en: Youth Square, Y Theatre

節目簡介: 《會》 去蕪存菁，揭示在律動中身心表達的迷人之處。作品結合了兩位澳洲藝術家的特色所在：Antony Hamilton充滿力量的舞蹈編排與Alisdair Macindoe令人著迷的機械操作，造就一次回歸基本的舞蹈探索。   兩位表演者與64台機械化的敲擊樂器共享空間。一系列持續不斷的活動展開，身體進入一種狀態：物理層面的強化、心理層面的流動，所有動作都是由機械化的節奏所帶動，猶如冥想中的脈搏。    Hamilton 獨特的身體語彙，配合Macindoe特製的樂器，構成一個純粹的演出。《會》將身體、空間及機械打造成一個既富有力量又不失趣味的舞蹈聲音裝置。   「《會》的視聽魅力讓人無法抗拒。眼前一切讓你感覺置身夢幻舞台之中。」 -Andrew Fuhrmann, Crikey.com

節目簡介: 舞蹈、音樂、劇場  離別 這一場戲，其實離我們不遠  《别 離別》音樂舞蹈劇場憑歌寄意，以形體舞蹈描繪一個又一個關於别離的故事，在説、舞、唱、動的過程中，將故事中無法闡述的情感揮灑遍地，觸碰心靈、觸動思緒 … 舞不盡，意難解，人生有太多太早的別離、太少的覺醒。
About the Programme: One of the most beloved comic ballets, Coppélia tells “a fairy tale without any fairies”.  Based on E.T.A. Hoffmann’s light-hearted story “The Sandman”, Coppélia follows the fantastic story of a mysterious inventor, his life-sized doll, and an inquisitive young couple. Franz falls madly in love with Coppélia, a beautiful mechanical doll he has seen at Dr Coppélius’ workshop, a place of mysteries and enchantment. Feeling mischievous, his fiancée Swanilda decides to impersonate the doll in order to play a prank on Franz, and chaos ensues! The charming scenes of frivolity and playful deception eventually result in a joyful celebration of the lovers’ wedding.  While this sparkling tale of magic and mischief is an endearing comedy of errors, full of warmth, romance, and laughter, Hynd’s delightful yet virtuosic choreography is a showcase for the dancers’ classical technique as well as their comedic and acting skills. With gorgeous sets and costumes by the award-winning Roberta Guidi di Bagno and enchanting music by Delibes, Coppélia will surely entertain fans of all ages.

About the Programme: Ballet in Two Acts Giselle is a classical ballet from the 19th century romantic era. Count Albrecht , who disguises himself as a peasant, has fallen in love with the peasant girl Giselle. However, Albert has been engaged with Bathilde. The shock is too great for Giselle and she dies with a broken heart. The grievous Albert visits Giselle’s grave. He then becomes the target of attack by the spirits. At last, Giselle helps him out of death.

節目簡介: 「春花秋月何時了，往事知多少。」 「問君能有幾多愁，恰似一江春水向東流。」 舞劇 《月冷西樓》講述南唐皇詞聖李煜一 心慈筆妙的一代文豪。 儘無政治野心，奈何生於帝王家, 卻終登基為帝。  宋軍圍城，南唐皇獻土歸汴，變為俘虜。亡國之痛使李煜詞作昇華，贏得「詞聖」之美譽。

節目名稱: 《藝摯二十週年匯演：匈牙利民族舞匯》
節目簡介: 3小時東歐舞蹈表演。這是香港「藝摯歐洲民族舞組」的二十週年舞蹈大匯演，特別邀請了年青匈牙利專業女民族歌手Júlia Kubinyi 和「匈牙利民族大使樂隊」(Hungarian FolkEmbassy) 從布達佩斯到香港和舞團作現場配樂，並在表演舞蹈的歌唱部分中合作演出。表演節目主要是匈牙利和外西凡尼亞 (Transylvania) 舞蹈組曲共十多首，大多數是「藝摯」舞團的原創編舞作品。另外也有其他歐洲國家的表演舞蹈, 包括土耳其、烏克蘭和保加利亞舞蹈。是次表演者近百人，來港參演的海外舞者共四十多人，分别來自「波亞斯歐洲民俗舞團」 (台灣)、「MFC匈牙利舞蹈俱樂部」 (台灣) 、「帕林卡匈牙利舞團」(日本) 及「盈思舞蹈社」(馬來西亞) 。以上個别海外團體與本舞團合作同台演出的舞蹈組曲共６首。
About the Programme: Kizomba is a dance and music genre that originated from Angola in the southern part of Africa. It has gone on to become a popular form of dance in Portuguese-speaking communities in Africa and around the world. Kizomba is a feisty combination of tango, zouk, samba and salsa, though the associated music is relatively slow. The elegant dance involves the pairs of dancers moving in close coordination in a series of sensual twists and turns. Here, workshop participants will start from the basics and learn to enjoy the charms of Kizomba in a relaxed atmosphere.
Venue: Auditorium, Sha Tin Town Hall
venue_en: Auditorium, Sha Tin Town Hall

節目簡介: 《re: do / Joseph Lee / KT Yau》分別集合了兩位年輕編舞的作品，李偉能(JosephLee) 及邱加希(KT Yau) 在2016年發表的的獨舞作品《回聲摺疊》和《睇我唔到》作為是次重演的主軸。  《回聲摺疊》探討表演者、創作與觀眾在演出當中不斷對調和轉換的角色關係；《睇我唔到》以強烈的視覺去表現舞者表演上的真實性、可見性與偽裝。兩位創作者均以自身作為藝術表現媒介的形式往內挖掘，試圖拓展及詰問觀眾對於舞蹈的想像。作為本地年青編舞，同樣關注舞蹈作為藝術創作的疑問，在一個晚上為觀眾帶來兩者面貌完全不同的創作。  而今次重演亦為兩位創作者提供一個平台在過往的創作中提煉靈感，共同創作及發展出新的段落，在重演以外發掘日後發展的可能。

Programme Name: WE Dance - Welcomes everyone to dance
節目簡介: 2017年9月至2018年2月，WE Dance將會在每月第二個星期日於「自由約」期間帶你投入舞蹈世界！WE Dance是一項社區參與舞蹈活動，讓你的身體隨著音樂自然舞動，在苗圃公園悠悠的環境中，享受一個無憂無慮的下午。 今年WE Dance帶來了不同舞種的體驗，9月的主題是以色列土風舞，香港舞蹈總會的導師會帶你感受以色列土風舞的強勁節奏以及簡單卻千變萬化的舞步。10月，一群來自香港演藝學院舞蹈學院的學生，將會打破大家對芭蕾舞高不可攀的印象，帶你重新認識芭蕾！ 11月，你可以跟Otrotango Dance Company學習以阿根廷探戈跟陌生人溝通的方法。如果想跟小朋友互動同樂，享受家庭樂時光，就不能錯過12月由榮雯舞蹈公司的老師和一班小助教帶領的拉丁舞工作坊。到了1月，WE Dance更會與你展開一趟在公園裡的舞蹈旅程！ 2018年2月11日──這就是WE Dance謝幕大派對的大日子，當天我們的合作夥伴將為大家帶來連續五個小時的精彩活動，絕對可以喚醒你內心的舞蹈本能！ 記得留意我們的每月節目內容，準備投入不一樣的舞蹈派對！
Venue: Nursery Park, West Kowloon Cultural District
